text: I've eaten here a lot, can't count how many times- im sure i have tried almost everything on the menu. Delicious!! This place in my opinion has the best authentic Italian Sub's in Chicago. Yes there is Bari- which is also my favorite- but Jp's is like going home for lunch- the people that run this place are the best, they make you feel like family. I'm a life long customer!

I enjoyed walking in and feeling like I was back to an earlier and simpler time. J.P. Graziano doesn't try to be anything it's not. Good sandwiches, fresh groceries, and staff members that work hard. My only wish is that my sandwich had a little more meat on it. The bread was tasty but outnumbered the meat 2:1.
Got there 25 minutes before closing. The clerk   said we ran out of bread, no sandwiches.

Walked by many times intrigued and finally stopped for lunch.  So glad I did!  Just had an Italian sandwich, and ready to explore with other sandwiches on next visit.  Just the right amount of meat/cheese ratio to bread and veggies!  Loved it!

I've had the sandwiches from Graziano's before and they're great, perfection, actually. The ingredients are all so fresh and high quality. I recently ordered off of the catering menu for a birthday party though, and was super impressed with absolutely everything, from the ease of ordering (with Deanna's help) to pick up, to how literally everyone loved the antipasti tray and sandwich selections!! The sandwiches are cut into a great little size so that people could grab one or two and vegetarians in the group loved the veggie sandwiches and the meat eaters demolished the rest, the Mr G was the biggest hit!! The antipasti tray was overflowing with meats, cheeses and artichoke hearts, olives& roasted eggplant, which were my selections, but I don't think you could possibly go wrong!!! Thx for making my party a success!!!

Graziano's is a Chicago classic, don't let anyone from NJ tell you otherwise. :) Stopped in for subs over the weekend and they were perfect as always. The Mr. G and prosciutto/fresh mozzarella were both delicious, well stacked on fresh bread. The bread itself is very soft in the middle with a thin crispy outer layer that almost shatters with each bite.  The decor is nice with antique architectural details and cool paintings on the walls. Deli counter is small but they have the goods. A half dozen different imported olives if that's your thing, and a couple of dry cured sausages. Small selection of imported dry goods, and interesting sodas. Service was very conscientious and genuine. The subs came out fast, and we sat out on the patio under the shaded awning to watch the world go by. Good spot for people watching, as there are lots of trendy restaurants nearby. Twice we were asked how the food was, and they basically waited on us which wasn't expected.  Bari's is great too, but if i'm in the west loop/Randolph St. area, I always make a beeline here.

I just started working in the West Loop and my coworker insisted we grab sandwiches here for lunch yesterday. Oh. My. LAWD. As a native New Yorker, I take Italian delis VERY seriously and this was outstanding. I got the Italian with mild giardiniera and nearly weeped tears of joy at my desk while I ate it. The bread, the meats, the cheeses, the spices, everything was perfect. I will go back and I will run in and scream "take all my money" because this is the best italian deli sandwich I've had since I left New York.
Delicious. The team there are always nice, and helpful. Whenever I am town, its my go to lunch location. YUM!

Today I was walking by the West Loop looking for a place to have lunch.  I was not craving anything particular and I had no plans to meet anyone. Fortunately, I bumped into this amazing jewel. I have  read about JP Graziano before but I had no idea where it was located so when I saw it, I knew I had to go in.  My experience there was beyond the expected. Not only was I welcomed by Jim, the very own grandson of the founder, but I was also able to appreciate how it is still a family business.  Although yes, the most popular sandwiches are the Italian and the Mr. G, I decided to go with the prosciutto. I do not regret it. The sandwich was huge, delicious, filled with good quality cheese and meat, and, on top of that, CHEAP!! I am definitely a fan and I am looking forward to go back and be pleased by another Graziano great experience.

Still love love this place.  Went again today. They have remodeled inside. Still looks cute. The staff are amazing.Love the Mr. G especially. Got a few olives on the side--they were fresh and delicious.  Sat outside at one of their outdoor tables. We have gotten their catering platters for social events--everybody loves them. I just pray they own the building. I worry that Randolph Street rents would drive them out. The  street used to be covered in meat markets and wholesalers--it's all becoming trendy restaurants now.  Hang in there Granziano's please@

I consider myself a sandwich connoisseur and I had the best sandwich of my life here! Go with the Mr. G, it's the house specialty for a reason. My boyfriend got the Italian, which is also great! The people who own the place introduced themselves to us; it was awesome and personable. Highly recommend!

I love J.P. Graziano. It's my favorite place for Italian sandwiches. It's also a family-owned neighborhood gem. Everyone that works here is so nice!  The Prosciutto is my go-to order. Thin slices of prosciutto di parma, fresh mozz, fresh basil, tomato & lettuce w/ red wine vinegar & oregano. They also sell other items you can find in an Italian deli, but I pretty much just go here for the subs. Perfect spot for lunch on the go in the West Loop.

Love the place - great subs, great price, and great service. Always get the Italian but saw they had some new subs using publican bread. Definitely need to try it. Turkey is really good too. Never have had their veg sandwiches, but there are 3 options.

Woke this morning with a craving for a great italian sandwich. I couldnt decide between Bari on grand or JP Graziano. Well i eventually picked the latter, and am I ever glad I did! I got the 'Mr G', a spin on a normal italian sub with their addition of marinated artichokes and some truffle mustard balsamic vinaigrette. The truffle isnt overpowering as some oils can be, the artichokes are mellow and bring a richness that meat and cheese alone cant provide. I'll be back!
Best Authentic Italian Sandwiches in the city. Period.  My favorite is the Caprese Sandwich.  Definitely get it with the Hot Giardinara and you'll be a happy camper!

We came here on our 1st day of our 4th trip to Chicago , after we had a terrible lunch at Roister. We ordered Mr. G (house specialty - imported sharp provolone, hot sopresatta, Prosciutto di Parma, Volpi genoa salami, truffle mustard balsamic vinaigrette, hot oil, marinated roman-style artichokes, fresh basil, lettuce w/ red wine vinegar & oregano) Sounds great, but coming from NY/NJ we have the best breads and sandwiches. This was alright... the bread wasnt crusty enough on the outside and wouldve been better with double the meat.

I've been to JPs only one time several years ago and I'm glad I stopped by for lunch again. The bf always get's the tuna sub and I decided to try the Mr. G sub. The bread was perfect.. light and crusty with a soft interior and a good amount of chew. I really enjoyed my sub. I asked for mine with easy sauces and I'm glad I did. The Mr. G sub was full of flavor from all the different meats, sharp provolone, marinated artichokes and the fresh basil leaves. Don't be fooled by the pictures, there is actually just one large artichoke heart placed right in the middle of the sub. If you are looking for a ton of meat, I'd try one of their other offerings. The sub was large enough to make 2 meals for me. My bf, on the other hand, devoured his entire tuna sub. I also had a cannoli for dessert. The menu description says "fresh filled," but they fill it earlier in the day. When you look at them through the display glass, you can see the juice from the marinated cherry bleeding into the ricotta filling. Despite the not so fresh appearance, it still tasted great. And fyi, there's some little chunks of unknowns mixed into the ricotta.
I got the spicy sandwich. It's good but a bit expensive for 9 bucks. Nice people though. I might go back but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

Make no mistake: the sandwiches are fresh, flavorful, and damn good. Both the conventional and the spicy version of the Italian are pretty perfect, and the Mr. G is dank: the superior cheese, the fresh basil, and the rich truffle mustard combine to produce a rare complexity of flavors and textures (because let's be real, plenty of places produce subs that taste like bedsheets because there are plenty of people who are glad to eat them).  But I go to Graziano's for the love. The ladies who ring you up in the back are all "Sweetheart" this and "My love" that, and they remember your face. : ) Even the guys who make the sandwiches have pretty sweet dispositions! The snug and cozy atmosphere seals the deal. The trek to Fulton Market is worth it for the salami and the ego boost alone!

I dont know how they take basic sandwich ingredients and make something that tastes this good. For sure a hidden gem in the west loop. I eat here as often as I can when working from home.  Personal favorite is the turkey with hot peppers. Also really good soup options seasonally.  Always the same folks working - very friendly and great service.

The best Italian sub I have ever had and I routinely try different Italian delis and grocers when I am traveling, including New York City. What did I like?  First when I ordered Jim had no problem with my request to add prosciutto and hot soppressata to my Italian sub. I love both in addition to the salami, capicola etc that comes on it. I also asked for very very hot. So the combo of the hot giardiniera and the hot capicola did the trick.  Perfect. But what you notice when you bite into the sun is the fresh bread. Crispy but not hard and soft and light under the crust. It holds and complements the meats, cheese and condiments but doesn't interfere with the flavor of the meats, cheese etc. I will be back ever single visit to Chicago. Go here. Now. And you will not be sorry. Did I mention my wife had the special?  Arugula salad with buffalo mozzarella. Delicious.
I was blown away by their hospitality, food was also good. Glad we didn't pass them up while we were waiting for our reservation @ a diner down the road.

Whenever I'm asked, "What's your favorite restaurant in Chicago?" my immediate answer is always, J.P. Graziano. This place practically writes the book on quality, Italian subs. Their bread is exceptional! It's crusty and chewy, but it doesn't upstage the meat! Everything they put on their sandwiches is fresh and high-quality.  My go-to order is the spicy Italian sub with hot peppers (swap out the red wine vinegar for truffle mustard--you won't be disappointed!). Amazing. Their hot peppers are out of this world. I love how the sandwich is served too....nothing special, just wrapped up in butcher paper; something about it just makes the sandwich feel that much more Italian deli. It's a cute little grocery setup, too. They have some nice imported drinks, and deli-style snacks, desserts, etc. Nothing to write home about in terms of the service; it's a pretty no-frills, order at the counter (pay at the window) joint. That system confused me a bit the first time I came here; you order your sandwich at the deli counter, and then move 5 ft to your left, recite your order to the person in the window and pay, and then you pick up your sandwich.  For a great, no fuss lunch and an exceptional sandwich: J.P. Graziano is your place!
Best in the city ! The sandwiches are out of this world . A must if your in the city or worth a little drive to get a great sub !
This place is worth checking out if you are in the mood for a good sandwich.  i had the Mr. G and it hit the spot for me.

Awesome no frills sandwich shop. An Italian sub like it should be! I ordered ahead thinking I would skip the lunch rush which worked well as no one was there when I walked in before noon. But I'm not sure how this works if it is busy as apparently the line wraps all the way around the store. I will be back to try their grocery items.

I have tried almost all the sandwiches! The family is so friendly and always makes me feel special. My favorites are the prosciutto, Mr. G, and Italian. When I was pregnant I lived off of the artichoke sandwich.

Having passed by more times than I can even count I finally decided to stop over to J.P. Graziano for lunch and I'm glad I did - they certainly make a solid sandwich. Upon entering, the first thing you'll notice is that this is a sandwich shop masquerading as a grocery store. Sure they have a few shelves and sell meat/cheese by the pound but they are in the sandwich business. And for good reason, they make a good sandwich! Being my first time I went with the Mr. G (the "House Specialty") and I wasn't disappointed. While I do think it needs a bit more meat the flavor combination was fantastic. Also, I added Dijon mustard and mayo and am so glad I did, the mustard made the sandwich a cut above. At first I thought it was a bit small, and while I prefer massive meals, it turned out to satisfy me. However, the price is a bit steep: for a sandwich and a drink I walked out $15 lighter... The experience and the sandwich are certainly worth stopping in for lunch. It's a bit far from The Loop to fit into my normal rotation, and pricey to boot, I will be remembering JPG for a while (and recommending it too).

This place is a gem of west loop. From the minute you walk in you can tell that you are being taken care of by true Italians. No shortage of choice, portions or hospitality here. Every time I come for a sandwich in lunch break the staff is friendly, efficient, and treats each guest like they are walking into their home for a meal. The Expo always remembers regulars orders and makes the experience flawless. Thanks for a great lunch break every time!

Incredible sandwiches, and they genuinely make you feel like you're a part of their family. Great place to go to for lunch, and their soups are always AMAZING (my vegetarian wife has loved every single one she has tried.) Eat here!

I have heard great thinks about this places sandwiches, especially the Mr. G. We walked in and greeted warmly by the staff. The gentleman that took our order was great and walked us through the menu and answered any questions we had. After we ordered we went to pay and the woman that rang us up was just sweet as can be. She was beyond friendly and helped us with their rewards program app. Once we got our sandwich both of them checked in on us to see how we enjoyed our lunch. The sandwiches were great, awesome meat and bread. But the hospitality was just amazing. We walked out of there and can't wait to go back. Love, love, love. Great job, guys!

Like mama used to make., best sandwiches in town. The crusty breads and selection of meats are fresh. It's a no frills deli with a counter and a spartan seating area. The majority of orders are takeouts.
Sandwiches: generous, confident, addictive. Family owners: warm, smart, committed (80 yrs on this spot!). Giardiniera: delicious on everything from pizza to cheese grits. None better!

I do not like sandwiches and especially not subs, and yet I love this place. The subs here are the only subs I will eat. The bread, the meats, their spicy condiments and everything is just right. We usually come to JP Graziano to buy deli meats and italian cheeses. During the summer they have some amazing mozzarella's - they have really out of the world deli meats, they are reasonable in price. Love the atmosphere and the home feel. They remember repeat guests. Second time we came they remembered us and since then they know who we are overtime we come. You don't find a lot of places like this where every customer is important. The place has been in the family for 3 generations and it is the oldest italian grocery market. The grandson still runs it with his sister and mom, and his children will one day take over. The fact that they also are a wholesale point for numerous Italian chefs, restaurants and italian markets should say it all. I like to go straight to the source of the good stuff.
Damn good sammiches. If you buy 10 you get a free one. Im mad about how good their soups are.

The owners are so friendly and passion about their business/food. There are so many regular customers come and go when we are there. That makes the place more homely. The sandwiches are fresh and full of lettuce ! love the Mr. G and Turkey. Also the soup is good.

Somehow I've lived in Chicago for over 7 years, eaten all over, and never been here before. It's been on my list for awhile but I always kind of pushed it aside for other places. It is a no frills Italian sub shop that also sells some meat, olives, and spices (like oregano) by the pound. I love sandwiches and bread, but I tend to actually shy away from some of the more loaded Italian subs because they load up way too much meat on them and it overpowers everything, or some of the other stuff overpowers it. I ordered the Mr. G - even though it sounds like one of those subs I usually shy away from. I'm really thankful I ordered it because it was really, really good. There are a handful of different types of meat, but it's not one of those sandwiches where it's a meat overload. Not even the artichokes overpowered the sandwich (they do on most). I can say it's one of the best balanced sandwiches I've ever had and would recommend it in a heart beat. Of course any sandwich connoisseur knows that the bread makes the sandwich too. Their bread? Awesome. Just the right kind of balance of hard and soft.  The people who work here are cool and personable too. Not that I'd recommend you driving an hour just to get a sandwich from here, but if you are in the area and want a really good sandwich, then check it out for sure.
If only parking was easier! A Chicago institution - just can't go wrong with their awesome sandwiches! Staff is authentically kind and helpful, lovin' it!

You can't go wrong here!! JPs is everything you've been searching for. An Italian sub is not usually my first (or second) choice but the Mr. G is perfect. Everything on it is perfectly portioned and no one ingredient overwhelms the next. The artichokes are like the cherry on top. I usually go at off times so I don't have to wait during peak lunch hours. It's the warehouse feeling, old-school Chicago place that reminds me why I love this city.

The sandwiches were amazing. However, my entire office ordered delivery, and the handwriting that told us what was what on the sandwich wrappers was completely illegible so we had an interesting time with that. Besides that it would be 5 starts.
Over rated. Ordered their signature sandwich it had like 3 pieces of meat and two slices of cheese. But if you want a veggies and spice sandwich this it. Don't bother

Dear JP, I heard alot about your sandwiches from people and even watching Chicago's Best and I must say It wasn't what I expected I ordered 3 Mr.Gs for my friends expecting the best from the rumors in the city  unfortunately didn't quite reach my taste buds. Mr.G was OK taste full of veggies and a slight taste of prosciutto lots of herbs and spices a hit of provolone it's a good sandwich for vegetarians not sure for meat lovers I recommend Luckys near Wrigleyville that place had me speechless.. literally

It might be authentic but I dont think it's THAT good. Had the Mr. G, tasted like an average sandwich to me. Now i dont mean avg like Subway avg, i mean like they can do alot better avg, if ur gonna be authentic. I've had Bari & even that place wasnt outstanding to me but better than here. The sandwich consisted of hard bread & tasted like nothing but oil. But Hey, what do u expect when they only put two thin slices of meat??

Ordered delivery from JP Graziano last week and had two sandwiches delivered. The service was friendly and the sandwiches were fresh and delicious. The marinated artichokes were a nice addition. Loses ones star bc I didn't particularly care for the bread but it is certainly traditional, and I wish they still had sun chips like they used to! Worth a stop.
We had the Porchetta and Roast Beef sandwiches - extremely nice, good service and the sandwiches were amazing!!! I'd definitely come back!

If you are into the family owned Italian sandwich shops this is exactly what you would hope for. Everything is fresh... the story speaks for itself and the sandwich puts chain brands to shame. As other's have mentioned ... the prices are competitive and the service is on point. The atmosphere is unique ... not high end ... it is a find a seat if you can and just enjoy the food type of joint .. so if you are expecting more you should plan to take your meal to go. I would definitely go back next time I am in the west loop.

Probably the best Italian sandwich in the city. Great old school feel in here you order at the counter then pay at a little window that looks like you should be placing a bet at the horse track not buying a sandwich. Everything is made to order which means it's all fresh. We had the Italian and the Mr G, the Italian was packed with meat great balance of lettuce and dressing all served on a real piece of bread crusty on the outside and  soft and chewy on the inside. The Mr G had more condiments artichokes, truffle mustard  it was more about the overall flavor then the meat plus there did not seem to be as much meat. My fav was the Italian Prices are great too big sandwich for 7ish bucks for the Italian and 9ish for the Mr G about the same prices as Jimmy Johns, Subway kinda crap but you get a real sandwich at J.P. Graziano.

this is my favorite italian sammie place.  i have been to most of them & i have good reasons. -family owned for generations-3 of the ladies working it now.  it's so nice to see them.  they treat you like family too. -all the subs are amazing & fairly priced.  i really like their turkey & imported provolone.  it just does not taste like any other one-it's the cheese & the love. -they have great swag!-i cherish my Mr. G. well fitting t-shirt so i can represent. -the best on every level.  the bread is super fresh.  the meats are amazing.  of course there's the cheese, the giardinara, the simple selection.... and the love.

Got the Spicy; it was as good, and almost as spicy, as I was hoping for, with quick service and fair prices for a sammie/chips/drink combo. As much as I loved it, it's really difficult to distinguish the quality at JP Graziano's from places like Vinnie's, Fiore Delicatessen, Bari, Nonna's, or other local sub shops.  If you are in the West Loop and want a cold sub, this is the call...but if I'm in Wicker, I'll have a different answer!

Classic Chicago sandwich shop that has been in the family for more than 50 years. I liked my sandwich but it was not hot so I did not love it. I'm rounding up from 3.5 stars because my girlfriend is a huge fan!

Manna from heaven!! As a kid, growing up in a family that had its own restaurant on Taylor Street, I took great Italian food for granted. Finding good - let alone great, or even excellent - Italian food in the last ten years has been shockingly difficult to find, even in my beautiful city, known for its great Italian fare. There are few places in town now that would live up to the high standards of my Aunt Annette, the captain of our family restaurant, and one of the best cooks I've ever known. For big summer family get-togethers, she would supervise the making of giant Italian submarine sandwiches, which would then be cut into smaller servings and everyone would grab a big napkin and a sammie and eat standing up. Each ingredient was carefully curated by Aunt Annette, and everything was the best quality. I've never tasted anything close to this great sandwich... until now. From the very first bite, I knew that Graziano's Itallian sub would meet with Aunt Annette's approval. Top-quality Italian deli meats, the freshest tomatoes and lettuce, the perfect blend of Italian herbs and just the right amount of red wine vinegar, all presented on the queen of Italian breads from D'Amato's Bakery, make for the perfect Italian Submarine sandwich. Its perfection brings a tear to my eye and a rumble to my stomach. When I make the pilgrimage out to the suburbs, where my dad - a cross between Joe Pesci and Paul Sorvino, and a true Taylor Street Italian - currently resides, I always try to bring him a Graziano's sub. They are the very best of their kind in our fair city, and you'd do yourself a favor to get over to Randolph Street and pick up one - or ten - of these perfectly balanced, top-quality ingredients, amazing Italian sandwiches. There are lots of places that have Italian subs on their menu, and some are pretty good. But none of them - NONE - stand even close to Graziano's in terms of quality, flavor, and superior craftsmanship. Graziano's has other subs on their menu, which are also delicious, made with top-quality ingredients, perfectly balanced flavors and lovingly crafted, and I've enjoyed several of them. They also have some great desserts, of which the raspberry bars and cannoli are my favorite. Ahhh, now I need one! Gotta go get me one-a them Graziano's subs! See ya there! ;)
I was born in Chicago so I always come back. Delicious sandwiches, humungous portions and unbeatable price!

These guys stuck the landing on all the classic Italian lunch sandwich specialties.  Plus, their delivery was amazing, timely and well organized and they were a dream to speak to on the phone. Can't say enough. Thanks guys.  Bonus points for having Mrs. Graziano actually take my order!

I started working in this area and I tried this place on my first day.  Well that was three weeks ago and I havent stopped since.  Hands down THE best sandwich I have gotten in the City of Chicago.  I go hear almost daily for lunch. Mr. G specialty sub is the way to go.  They have the best freshest cuts to date The people who work here are second to none.  Some of the nicest family oriented people ever!  Can't wait to eat through their menu again. I'll see you tomorrow

The subs here are just ok, nothing memorable. The ordering system is very confusing.  5 people who came in after us and ordered before us because we did not know which line to stand in.  I really did want to like this place because the people were really nice.   Bari's is still my go to for great subs but I was hoping to find a place with great subs where you can sit down and eat them. Still hunting....

I LOVE this place. It is just an incredible Italian sandwich spot. Reminds me of the Italian market in Philly. The sandwiches are so delicious. Mr. G is my all time favorite (artichokes, salami, prosciutto, cheese, pepper, olive oil/vinegar and truffle mustard), but every sandwich I have had there is just as good. They have a great little patio outside to eat your lunch and the staff are always incredibly friendly and helpful. It is clearly a family owned and run business and it shows! Definitely a "go to" neighborhood spot!!

Loved the atmosphere of Italian deli where they slice the meat and sell huge olives and fresh cannolis.  Had the mr g sandwich which is good but a bit salty for my taste.  Will try porchetta next time and skip the mustard.

The sandwiches here are solid, although not the BEST sandwiches I've had (my friends beg to differ) I think they have really good sandwiches.  Their meat is well prepared, and they do have a really good brownie.

What a great little spot in the heart of some expensive restaurants. Their sandwiches are what jimmy johns should taste like. All their meats and cheese are bursting with flavor. I would like the bread a little softer, but its definitely authentic. they serve these focaccia rolls with cheese and meat stuffed in them. they were an absolute treat and would highly recommend them. I wish they were open a little later than 5, but its more of a lunch place anyways.
Believe the hype and just go!!  Get the porcetta sandwich, I may be buried with one!!!
1000 on a 10 scale. Plan Product People executed to perfection.  Closest thing you'll find to going to your Italian Friends picnics.  Porketta sand with the Aliola sauce unbelievable!!!!!

Nothing special, fluffy bread with zero flavor, very little meat for 9$? bari down the street is the same if not better and cheaper. People that are giving this place 4 or 5 stars clearly have never had a good sandwich before, seriously.

I don't think I have ever been thanked so many times for stopping in for a quick lunch in my life.  From the guys welcoming us and making our sandwiches to Mrs. Graziano at the cash wrap, we felt incredibly welcomed and valued.  We got two sandwiches (caprese and porchetta) as well as a cannoli and everything was top notch.  The bread was fresh, and the sandwiches were absolutely packed with tasty fillings.  There were so many more delicious sounding sandwiches that we will certainly be back to try.  And the cannoli?  So tasty! It was still crispy and flaky with sweet little amarena cherries on the ends.  Two enthusiastic thumbs up!
By far the best sub I've ever had in my life. At the very end of the sub I was seriously considering throwing up the sub so I could enjoy it again. The staff made the experience 10x better.

When you walk into JP Graziano you know what you're going to get each time you enter, amazing service and an incredible meal. Not only does JP have some of the best sandwiches on the planet, everyone who works there is very kind and welcoming. I can't recommend this place enough. The prosciutto is hands down my favorite.

Drove over an hour to come here after seeing them reviewed on Check Please!  Wow! Amazing sandwiches! Large and excellent prices - quality and quantity! Try the Italian! Or the Porchetta! Perfect balance of meat, freshest bread, and dressings. Service was so friendly and engaging!  We will be back soon! Thanks for a great lunch!

My office order lunch from here and not only was the staff on the phone friendly but they were extremely accommodating. The food was delicious and at a great price for the amount we ordered. Try the Mr. G the truffle oil mustard on it is so good!

I came here today with a few colleagues and we could not have been happier.  The service, ambiance and food were spot on!  I had the Tuna Sandwich with the giardiniera.  The tuna was made to order- not canned and you can tell.  It wasn't drenched in mayo which I appreciated and the bread was perfect- soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside.  We also ordered a few cannolis for the table and they were divine.  The service was friendly, helpful and professional, I pray this doesn't fall victim to the rising rent prices in the west loop becuase J.P. Graziano's MUST stay.  I will most definitely be back, 5+ Stars!
Great spot for lunch. Awesome subs. Well worth the price and the wait (at rush lunchtime tine). Can even buy gallon jugs of gardinera.

Great Italian subs! I got the house special and it was perfect, add the Dang soda and I was a happy girl! The customer service was also great, I was waiting on my husband to park and they told me that they would put bread aside for our sandwiches as they were down to 5 loaves and didn't want me to miss out. How considerate!

I LOVE Jp Graz. It's family owned and you can tell how much heart and soul goes into it. I love the staff. They're the best. You can't go wrong with any sandwich or soup. Cannolis are also delicious. I'm team JPG all day (sorry, Bari). I live a block away and am here almost every Saturday. Highly recommend to anyone looking for an amazing sandwich served by genuinely good people.
Great subs, friendly service.  Cost more than Subway, but that's because they're 10x more delicious, better bread, better ingredients.  They're real.

I stopped here for lunch today, as it was close to my hotel and I couldn't resist a good Italian style sub. (In Atlanta, these are pretty much non-existent) I went with the classic Mr. G's with hot peppers and a cannoli.  The sandwich was really good! Nice and savory with a spicy kick from the hot peppers, and fresh bread soft on the inside and crisp on the outside. The cannoli was great, and I especially loved the cherries on each end. The staff have me a family-owned feel, nice and comfortable. If you dine in, you pay at the end of the meal -- in case you feel like grabbing extra goodies. My only wish was for drink options other than bottled.  I will definitely return the next time I'm in town! Looking forward to trying some of the other items on the menu.

JP is a failsafe when you don't know what else to order or what kind of mood you're in for lunch.  The sandwiches are delish. I have a regular order with the caprese or caprese add turkey. However my husband is always trying a different kind of sandwich and raving about it right after - or during in some cases - ehem, lookin at you Mr. G. Also important to note - any deli serving Joe iced tea is a true friend, and the little dessert snacks are tasty as well. I just really enjoy the experience of being inside the shop. The employees are all super pleasant and friendly and make you feel like one of the family. Yes I agree with some other Yelpers - the first time you go in ordering and payment may be confusing but just ask someone!! They are so nice and will help you out without making you feel dumb like a moody barista at a hipster cafe would. Once you've done it one time you're a pro, ok?   The only criticism I have is from my visit today (haven't experienced it any other time) is that someone had just clearly been smoking in the payment office, and as I stood and waited by the window I almost dry heaved in the other patrons' faces! I'm usually not a snob about this but I'm preggers and was starving and the smell smoke inside of a food establishment is enough to make even a pregnant woman lose her appetite! This doesn't skew my general image, but please add to your lovely experience by taking the fumes outside. Overall, a great place for a yummy sandwich!
the best sandwiches you will ever have in your life. *currently salivating while fantasizing about one in and around my mouth.*

Hello, FOOD SNOB here. This place does not stand out as a sandwich joint.  But WOW the sandwiches are really really good.  Had half of the prosuitto di parma. And half of the Mr. G.  Good old fashion quality.  Nothing fancy iside but good enough.  The grocery part is basicly Italian Deli and a few Italian items.  Freesh bread too.   Very friendly service too.  I liked being called SWEETIE.

Respect.  Gotta respect a family run establishment that can hold their own on West Randolph street with the Chevals, Goats and whatever up and comer that has real estate here. So if you love the newer guys on the block, you should still pay homage to a classic. I love the friendly feel of the place.   "What can I get you sweetheart?"  Anyplace else a line like that would be super corny, but not here.  I studied the menu beforehand and opted to get a Mr. G and Porchetta to split with my husband.   "Everything on it?"  Why mess with what works.   Both sandwiches were delicious.  I would say the Porchetta was my favorite of the two.  I loved the Arugula and the Lemon Caper Aioli--it really enhanced the flavors of the porchetta.  The Ciabatta was a litte too much crusty bread for me, so I made it into an open face sandwich instead.  I wonder if they'll make the same sandwich on the D'Amato Italian Bread...because that bread on the Mr. G was fabulous. The bread was a little crunchy on the outside, but then bit down to a soft chew.  Super fresh and smelled so good.   Also, do yourself a favor and try the Italian Cherry Soda drink from their cooler.  It was so tasty and refreshing.  I would love to have bottles of that at home on hand for a pick me up.  Like others have said, order at the deli counter, grab drinks from the cooler and pay at the "office window".   Parking is a bear, but I didn't mind the walk from where I parked a few blocks away.   Tuna.  I think the tuna is the next one I will try.  Thanks JP!

How have I missed this place? In my many escapades to the west loop, I have managed to over pass this original Chicago classic. As Randolph street has expired over the years, JP definitely carries its own. Friendly service & quality subs, hoagies, what ever you call it, it's a must try & return kind of place! We ordered the Spicy & the GT (I think that was it),& by the first bite as that zing of provolone hits your taste buds you know you're trying something wonderful! Bravo!

Grocery is more apt of a description than sandwich stop.  Its not a great environment for a meal. Limited seating, no ambiance, and it was very cold.  Lastly, its not kid friendly so eating with a 14 month in your lap isn't great either. Grab something to go. The meats were incredible.  I would totally come back to make use of the deli, for my own charcuterie or something like that. The porchetta was amazing. The bread was good but it was pretty hard, you had to really bite in and then literally tear away each bite.  Sides were lacking except for chips.  The Mr. G was pretty great, the artichokes were a nice combo. I'd be back but not for a meal.
I liked the flavor but was disappointed at the amount of deli meat on the sandwich for the cost.

I've been coming here for about 8-10 years, which I think is around the time they were just getting started with the subs. My family has been coming her for decades. I came for cheese and discovered their wonderful subs. I am so happy to see how popular they have become. I'm even happier knowing that throughout the expansion of their sub business, the quality of the subs, products,and service has been maintained. They treat you like you're family when you come in. So many places start skimping on ingredients or leave out the TLC once they become popular and busier. That is not the case here! I am so happy that they are getting so much well-deserved recognition.

It was ok nothing out of this world sandwhixh was  have had in Pittsburgh were much better and the bread was hard and didn't seem fresh. Maybe I should come in and eat instead of delivery if I ever go there to eat.

Absolutely the best sandwiches.  Every component of the sandwiches are fresh, high quality ingredients. Excellent, friendly, efficient service from the moment you walk in the door--immediate, pleasant acknowledgement (even when they're busy), clear direction, from the order facilitator/sandwich maker and the cashier.  Wonderful business!

We were in the area and stopped in for some sandwiches. Last time we had them for our family picnic and everyone thought they were tasty and unique. I wanted to try a different sandwich, so I got the antipasto while my Pops got the classic Mr. G. I really liked this sub. Definitely a little lighter than a Mr. G but filled with all the fresh ingredients that combined quite nicely. The peppers, cucumbers, olives and meat combined into a really flavorful sandwich. The D'Amato bread is also quite good. You feel it and think "Ugh this is going to be way too crunchy!" But the inside is softer and gives a crusty outside that adds texture to the sandwich. The staff has been helpful and very nice to us both times we have been in. Customer service here is stellar. Still a little expensive, but definitely a quality sandwich and a unique store.

They make really great sandwiches with some quality meats. They get their bread from D'Amato's, so it's soft-ish of the inside but has a slight bit of crunch on the outside. Whatever giardiniera they use is also great. I usually dislike giardiniera, too oily and not flavorful (other than a not very distinct spiciness), but I do like theirs on the Italian sub. I wish they were open slightly longer hours.

The sandwiches are good but the setup of the space / how you pay is a bit odd and really bottlenecks the whole experience. The people who work there are very nice and helpful.  I would go for lunch again but it's not the best sandwich I've ever had!
Underwhelmed by the Italian sandwich. The bread was too hard and there was almost no flavor to the sandwich. I was expecting magic with such good Yelp reviews and it didn't deliver.

This place makes the best Italian style subs in the city (sorry Bari's).  These sandwiches are thoughtfully handcrafted works of delicious art. The porcheta sandwich is absolutely delicious and enough for two people. This sandwich is perfectly paired up with a slightly tangy aioli and arugula on excellent bread (ciabatta) from Publican bakery. The Mr G special is also delicious with the artichoke hearts.  Also, don't overlook the delicious cannolis with cherries on each end. Prices are reasonable and the service is friendly.

Best Italian Deli in the city, lot of cops hang out here. Fast, fresh, tons of oil and vinegar. Perfecto to the tee. Skip Bari, Jim and his family have been running this corner and the sandwich scene in Chicago for over forty years. They are also a grocery that wholesales the best meats and cheeses. If you don't know what to get try the 9 inch classic or get the artichoke for vegetarians.

Happy time! Sometimes you just want a good Italian or Proscuitto on crusty bread.  This place delivers. Small time feel, walk in, order and the counter, pay at the back.  VERY good sandwiches. I have each of them on the menu.  I keep going back, I have had the desk at work order here.   Their spicy isnt that spicy... and sometimes I would like a touch more meat.  But otherwise, I love it.  Will keep going back happily.

This was my first time at JP's. Staff was friendly and the lady  (who I believe may be the owner) was very nice and accommodating.   But now for the sandwich. I'm a huge fan of Italian deli sandwiches. I'm walking distance from both Fontano's and Conti. My go-to has always been Conti but that may have just changed. Their Italian sandwich was amazing. To me what stood out the most was their bread. By far the best out of thee three. It has that crunchy outside crust which I love. The meat is great and they don't skimp on the hot peppers.  My only issue is that I wish it was walking distance like the other two!! I will definitely be back and very glad I decided to switch it up!

Sandwiches are always really good. Spicy ITALIAN is my go to, and always grab a unique soda from the selections too.  Reasonably priced for the neighborhood and quality is unquestionable. Good meats and cheeses on a perfect bread for the sandwich.
Amazing subs Prosciutto is fresh  Fresh cannoli with a cherry Nice family owned business, friendly staff  If wanting lunch or a sandwich good quality and quick service I would go here if in west loop

Very good sandwiches. The bread is the right amount of crispy, the ingredients are fresh and the employees are awesome. The Mr. G is good but I usually go with the Prosciutto sandwich with mozzarella. Simple and delicious. Can't beat it. What's keeping it from getting 5 stars? The hot capicola isn't hot at all. Honestly, that's a big thing for me

Satisfying every time!! I work down the street for about a year now and it's a great place to grab lunch, great subs, much better than the chain that rides around by far. always fresh and the family that runs it are great too, nice to be recognized as a familiar face, that service goes a long way, esp in an area where lunch options are endless.
Amazing Italian Subs, great customer service and reasonable with the price. Keep up the great work.

I got the most popular sandwich as a salad, the Mr. G sub. It was a pretty expensive lunch and it didn't have as much flavor as I would have expected. I'd probably go again, but i'd try a different sandwich and i wouldn't get it as a salad.

This place is everything that I hoped it would be and more! Think amazing assortment of Italian meats, super fresh breads and homemade giardiniera. Combine those all together and multiply the awesomeness by 100. Really, really, really fresh ingredients! I tried the Spicy which is hot capicola, pepperoni, hot sopresatta, provolone, tomato & lettuce w/ red wine vinegar & oregano. Don't forget to add the hot giardiniera to top it off! Really Loved this sandwich and already planning on going back to try the Mr. G (since I've read so many positive reviews about that sandwich on Yelp)

Ordered an Italian sub on uber eats and was exited to try it based on Yelp reviews. I need to agree with the other reviews that are a bit critical of the quantity of meat being delivered and the general tommy satisfaction delivered.  The reminded me more of a Nola po-boy than a hearty Italian. The bread was crusty but really airy and didn't have much substance. Some like this kind of bread but I like a denser dough. Meat was good but you do only get a single layer of each type of meat and honestly it's not much- see the pic.  The price is good but definitely not my favorite and I would say this place probably isn't worthy of the 4.5 star rating. Maybe because there just aren't many of these types of joints here in chicago?
Best Italian sandwiches in the city.   Also one of the nicest families you've ever met own and operate the place.    Pretty much a win-win.

Tried this place Saturday, loved it.  Besides tasting great, I was thrilled that they take debit cards, and have a public restroom-both of which unfortunately are a rarity in the neighborhood's trendy places.  I will definitely go back again!

What can I say that hasn't already been said?  Fresh, simple and delicious made to order Italian subs that dont miss regardless of which one you choose.  My co workers and I will make special trips from the north loop when we get the craving.  JPG is an institution and is always worth the trip.

This place is right by my office, so I struggle to keep my visits down to roughly twice a month, because I could easily eat their sandwiches every day. The ingredients are top-quality, and paired with finesse and skill so that every sandwich is a perfectly-balanced symphony of flavors. Their fresh mozzarella is creamy, with pure dairy flavor, and I don't know how they manage it but their basil is pungent and perfect year-round. I also love the family atmosphere, which reminds me of my own big, Italian family. The fact that they recognize me whenever I come in just makes me feel like part of their family too!

I am a huge cold cut sandwich fan. I eat at least 3 a week for lunch. The mr. G may be the best one I have ever had. It is a 9 to 10 dollar sandwich that is worth every penny. Everything is fresh and so flavorful including the herbs. I wish I had one of these down the block from my house!

Great subs hands down!!!  The Mr G and the spicy subs hands down the best subs I've had in a long time. I would absolutely cater for a lunch time event from there. Tip; go early as they may run out of bread.

I've lived in Chicago for eight years and accepted the fact that Chicago doesn't understand what a good sub is during my first month here. I came to JP Graziano's expecting to have my opinion flipped upside down, as all of my Chicago native friends said that I would.  What I got was the same uninspired sandwich on a dried out flakey roll that more resembles a stale dinner roll at a bad restaurant than something worthy of containing premium Italian meats and condiments. It's not that the ingredients aren't great on paper, because they are. It's very difficult to mess up top notch cold cuts and giardiniera, but for some reason they all manage to do just that by stuffing the sandwich into that horrible Chicago French roll. Bari, Vinnie's and Lucia's are all guilty of the same thing.  This city needs DiBella's so bad. This could have earned three stars if they had just thrown the bread out and given me all the other sub ingredients by themselves.

I was not blown away by the 5 star rating. We ordered a four-platter, with a Mr. G, Proscuitto, Artichoke, and Italian.  3.5: the artichoke was a well-balanced sandwich, with too little meat and the bread was hardly filling. Despite eating a sandwich and half, was starving most of the afternoon.  3: It tasted too similarly to the artichoke, which quite dampened my enjoyment. Mr G: "House Specialty! Sharp imported provolone, hot sopresatta, Prosciutto di Parma, Volpi genoa salami, truffle mustard balsamic vinaigrette, hot oil, marinated roman-style artichokes, fresh basil, lettuce w/ red wine vinegar & oregano ..."  4: Proscuitto, now this one I would get again. It is definitely the most flavorful of the combination, with the fresh mozzarella and basil really delighting the tongue. Mmmmmm... 3: Italian, forgettable.

Can't say enough great things about this place. Such friendly and kind hearted people working here. Gotta love 4 generations of a family run business. The sandwiches here are very authentic and good. Very fresh with high quality ingredients as well. They give you a pretty large sandwich for the cost too. I'm sad it took me this long to discover such a gem, but now I foresee myself visiting here at least once a week. Thank you Jim Graziano, you truly rule.

Outstanding!  A find!  As good as it gets!  In this trending neighborhood where the Rick Bayless' and Nomu's are moving in, JP Graziano is a throwback establishment --- family run, started by the grandfather, great food, outstanding service, it's not to be missed.  I'm hoping the family owns their building as that will give them insurance against a sea of what will be rising rent expense in this hot area just west of downtown Chicago.

I ordered the Mr. G and the Italian with everything on both of them. DELICIOUS! Incredibly nice customer service, they were happy to answer any and all of my questions with patience (I'm from out of town you see). The artichokes, the cheeses, meats, mustard/spread were worked perfectly together! I originally planned on ordering my sandwiches and taking them to go, but the outdoor seating next to the shop was too inviting to pass by. Each sandwich comes with a drink and a bag of chips also, of course its included in the price, but it makes the eating experience that much more enjoyable! If you're looking for a quick and delicious Italian sub, I would definitely recommend stopping by :)
Amazing atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff. True Chicago gem!!!!  Sandwiches are fresh and delicious- true Italian subs.

I can't say enough good things about JP's. It is without a doubt the best sandwich spot in Chicago. I always get the Mr. G, but I recently started dabbling in other sandwiches. Although I felt a little bad cheating on Mr. G I found I was missing out on a whole world of utter deliciousness! Most recently I got a roast beef on the jalapeno ciabatta and it changed my life. The whole Graziano family is wonderful. They treat their customers like family and make their sandwiches with love! Go get yourself one and you'll never look back.

This is one of those places that is as good as everyone says it is! I noticed it had been in my bookmarks for quite awhile and its only a 3 stop green line train ride from the office. I've always heard about the awesome 9 inch Italian sub so thats what I chose to get. It was very good...actually one of the best Italian subs I've ever had. Didn't take them a long time to prepare even though they had a nice line inside as over 50% of the people waiting had ordered the Italian. They sell cheese and other things here as well hence the term grocery store. They have outside seating on the side of the building so you don't have to order and dash.

We tried 4 different sandwich joints in 1 day, specifically looking for the best Italian sub sandwich. We found it here!  Al's  beef was good but did not qualify as an Italian sub. And Fiores was very good, came in 2 nd place.  But the bread used at Grazianos put this sandwich over the top. Perfect balance Of exceptional italian meats and cheese. Nice spice with the peppers.  Very simple place with only a few round tables. Great lunch spot if you want a great sub sandwich.

This morning, I read Thrillist's "50 things to eat in Chicago before you die" ,  thrillist.com/eat/chicag… . Realizing I could die soon, given my almost senior status, I devised a plan to entice hubby into trying a couple-two-tree of these joints tonight.  My brilliant strategy was to convince him to split #16 with me;  the sub from JP Graziano Grocery 'The Mr. G', as hubby IS a connoisseur of Chicago Italian subs, and in turn, I would share my Au Cheval's single burger #18 that I have been hankering to try. They are a block from each other. So off we go. It's 4pm, and we have an hour to get downtown before JP Grazianos closes for the evening. Forgetting that it's rush hour, we arrive at 3 minutes to five... he double parks and i jump out to place the order for one Italian sub.  I am met at the door by someone who informs me that the place is closed... I'm practically in tears, and beg to order one sandwich to go. The guys inside are more than happy to accommodate me (Kudos!)  I'm instructed to go to the window and pay, and they'll make the sandwich.  At the window, I am met by a very amiable guy 'Jim', and explain our hours drive and the food bucket list from Thrillist... He rings up my order then shouts to the guys making the Italian sub :" Make a 'Mr G.' too."  That's when I realize, in my haste I had ordered the wrong sandwich. He turns to me and says "The Mr. G is on the house" WHAAA????  Turns out, this great guy Jim, is the grandson of the original proprietor JP Graziano. He is trying (successfully I think) to move his family-owned business into a new era. We discuss all things Italian while they make the sandwiches, and when he bags my order, he throws in 2 provolone and giardiniera buns he's testing...gratis! (Oh yummmm). In those simple gestures...1) gracefully accepting a late order after a long day, and 2) very generously sharing his food...  before I had even TRIED the sandwiches, he has made life-long clients. The hour drive is/WAS worth it!  BRAVO Giacomo!   Au Cheval will wait for another day :) p.s. The subs ROCKED...both of them. The connoisseur (hubby) changed his mind 3 times... Mr. G won by an artichoke!
I thought it was just ok. I had the Mr.G. I felt like their signature truffle sauce had a strong aftertaste. Also the bread was very crunchy. I think Jersey Mike's sauce is way better.

Fantastic sandwiches!  I got the Italian and it was everything you want a sandwich to be; loaded with meat, fresh veggies, soft bread...... I could go on and on. The employees are super friendly and checked on how our sandwiches were and offered to wrap the left overs up for us. It's a hit, I can't wait to come back!
BEST place ever!! Have gotten subs over the years and LOVE them. Today, I got the JPG salad and it's delicious! I'd recommend it to anyone! Thanks for the delicious food!!

Nothing better than an old-school Chicago sub sandwich in the historical Randolph Market area. They've got everything from ham, turkey, tuna, and even their own special invented sub. Fresh baked bread, fresh veggies. And they take pride in their great, personal customer service and friendly attitude.
This place was nice and small. The sandwiches were simple and quite good, and the workers/owners were super friendly. But it's no Italian Store (shout-out to DC)

Is there a Graziano different than the one I visited? One where they actually serve good food. I came expecting an amazing experience and I got a veggie sandwich. For the life of me I cannot comprehend how people are eating these  sandwiches with 3 slices of thinly cut deli meat and calling them the best in Chicago. I'm at a lost for words. Biting in this sandwich and you'll taste nothing but bread and lettuce. At $8-10 a pop I'm so confused that this is found acceptable. The meat definitely seems high quality, but I couldn't tell as you couldn't taste it. I got a spicy and an italian, and you could NOT tell the difference. AT ALL. I hate trashing family owned establishments. The workers were extremely nice and accommodating and make you feel welcome, but they charged us for adding mayo to an 8$ sandwich with 3 layers of meat. That is un-acceptable and I will never come back to this place. And this further proves my idea that if Chicago bred yelpers hype it, it's likely beyond terrible.

In my family we say the quieter we are, the better the food - because we're so busy eating that we aren't talking.  I took my husband to JP Graziano and neither of us said anything until we finished our delicious sandwiches (he got Italian and I got turkey).  YUM!  Save room for gelato too!

Having been a loyal patron of Bari for as long as I can remember, I was hesitant to try a sub made by any other establishment.  Typically, I order a 9" Italian sub at Bari so for purposes of comparison,  I ordered the equivalent at JPG. Surprisingly, the sandwiches were almost the same.  Bread had a crispy crust, meat & the cheese & veggies were freshly sliced.  Why do I give Bari 5 stars and JPG only 4?  (a)  The giardiniera at Bari is better tasting, (b) Bari sub has a few more ounces of meat & cheese  (c) cost of the 9" Italian sub at Bari is $4.75 and at JPG  it's  $7.25 ($ 2.50 more) (d) although JP Graziano Grocery Company has "Grocery" in the title, there isn't much of a selection.  Bari on the other hand, has an ample selection of deli, meat, produce, dairy, & groceries, and (e)  since the majority of customers drive to both of these establishments, parking is much easier at Bari.

Pretty good! Full disclosure.......they're not trying to flatter you with ambiance in here, so don't have your expectations too high in that regard.  However, if you're looking for a solid sandwich and maybe a cup of soup, you're in the right place. They have a couple unique sandwich options and everything is really fresh. I had the Italian and it was very tasty. Not the best I've ever had, but very solid. There are only 2-3 small tables if you want to eat there, but this place is really setup for you to get your sandwich and scram! You pay for your purchase in a corner at a bookie type booth thing.  This seems to be a family owned establishment and everyone was very nice and friendly. I would definitely return when I'm in the area.
Got the eggplant sandwich and even the cannoli for later! Best local spot for a quick lunch - nice service and that sandwich was delicious (so fresh!)! Must go!

I love artichokes! So pickled baby artichokes on my Mr. G sandwich definitely made me happy. And cannolis. My mushroom and sausage soup was better than I expected and hit the spot at the time. I don't think you'd go to J.P. Graziano for the ambiance. It's kinda rough. Like, it reminds me of an Italian version of Shameless (Showtime).  It seems like a family business and everyone works hard. You don't really sit down there, but I did. They have two (maybe three) small tables. Just to be clear: there's no waiter service. 1) You order from the manly guys at the sandwich counter. 2) You pay at the window in the corner. 3) You return to the many guys for your sammy. 4) You either sit or go. They can take Level Up payments (an app) which definitely caught me off guard. You pay at a window. Like the ticket counter at a movie theater. Or a bookie. There's glass between you and the mother of the place. I'm not sure how the grocery store part works. The sandwich part dominates. And rightly so because the sandwiches are good. Mine was huge and lasted for two meals. It was history. And culture. And yumminess.
Great sandwich!  Told this is one of the best sandwich places in Chicago.  Being from New Jersey, I agree that this is a great sandwich place.

I'm not sure how I feel about the Mr G sandwich. I came in on a Saturday so maybe that's why my experience was sub par. The breast did not taste fresh. The ingredients within the sub had some unique flavors but each was very subtle. Nothing popped in flavor/there was no star of the show. Good flavor but just not enough if it.

Really, really great sandwiches. I got the Mr. G and loved it, and I also got some kind of little roll thing that had the infamous hot gardinara that was highly recommended by other Yelpers, and it was DELICIOUS. I loved the bread itself, too! One star docked simply because the guy who took my order was kind of rude, but the sweet lady behind the checkout counter made up for it. Definitely a "local" spot--they seemed surprised that someone who wasn't from the neighborhood had found them, haha. Apparently the sandwich daily specials are great, too, so don't miss those either!

I stop here ever time I'm in the West Loop for outstanding Italian sandwiches; fresh meats, cheeses, veggies piled on THE BEST bread around!!  Bari is a close second, but these guys are the best, in my opinion.
One of my favorite sandwich places in Chicago. I strongly recommend. Wonderful service, too.

My buddy said I had to try the house favorite Mr. G... he claimed it's one of the best sandwiches he's ever had. I was excited, and placed my order.  The line up of ingredients leans towards the tangy side, with pickled artichoke hearts, vinegared lettuce and truffle mustard balsamic vinaigrette. I'm glad I asked for the addition of mayo, as it really helped balance the brightness and also... come on, mayo is good on anything.  The SUPER thinly sliced sharp provolone, hot sopresatta, prosciutto and genoa salami offered a great textural experience especially complimented by the chunky artichokes. I was already a fan of d'amato's crispy flaky bread and found it was a perfect vessel for the delectable imported meats and cheese. This is a high quality sub my friends.  Next time, I'm going to try the tuna as it's made to order and looks awesome. Chicago is ruining me. J.P. Graziano sets a high bar for delicious sandwiches.
I've been here many times but only ever gotten one sandwich: the Mr. G.  Other things on the menu might be good.  The Mr. G is off the charts.  In my opinion the best sandwich in Chicago.
Classic sandwich with a genuine family atmosphere.  Mr. G or Tuna are recommended--always everything on it, always.

Best. Subs. Ever. I love this Italian deli! I just moved right around the corner and was searching for a new sub spot. I'm so glad I found this gem. My only complaint is that I wish they were open on Sundays and later during the week.

JP Graziano does not need another 5 star review but I have so much love for this place I just can't resist!  Everyone is so nice and everything on the menu is always fresh and always amazing!  My favorite is the veggie!

J.P Graziano's has some of the best sandwiches I have had in Chicago. Their store is super cute inside and they have tons of homemade items, but today we ordered sandwiches to be delivered to my office. It was a 6 dollar delivery charge but well worth it, especially when split among people. I called and spoke with THE nicest lady ever. Super pleasant. All of us got the Mr G. sandwich, and I got their housemade hot giardiniera added to it. It was a huge sandwich and the giardiniera was delicious and super duper hot. My mouth was burning but in a good way, if that makes any sense. I was so full from eating it, but I made sure to finish it because I didn't want to have to share any leftovers with my S.O....You can't blame a girl.

If I could give this 3.5 stars I would. It's better than average but I wasn't as wowed as I thought I would be given the Yelp reviews and the spot on Chicago's Best awhile back. I grabbed a sandwich to go from JPG's - a prosciutto sandwich specifically. Now, not being a fan of tomatoes, I asked them to substitute giardinere instead. But when I got home and dug in, I didn't really notice it - in fact, I think they forgot it altogether (though the sandwich was sans tomato, which was a good thing!).  The bread was good, the prosciutto could have been a little more robust. I plan to try the place again - I honestly feel a bit like an outcast with the three star review, but I've had better sandwiches at Capri in River Forest, Alpine and Al & Joes.

One of the best Italian sandwich shops I have been to. The Italian was my favorite until I tried the tuna. Yes, tuna! This place uses giardiniera that will change your life. Together you have the Hot Tuna which I get every time I'm in town, including today. Love!

WOW. First time trying J. P. and it was truly amazing! I've heard great things about this place and it for sure exceeds the reviews. 5+ stars!! Everyone in the shop was so friendly, too. Definitely going back.

I've been to J.P. Graziano a couple of times and always liked it, but it wasn't until my last visit that I fell flat out in love. Why? Four syllables...giar-din-er-a. They make their own and It's pretty undeniable that this pepper mix makes everything better. After I had it on their tuna I was stunned. It adds the perfect spicy kick to any of their sandos and even if it doesn't normally come that way you can custom add. It does come on their house made tuna though, and it's incredible. It ups the status making it about the best I've ever had.  Also, definitely try Diana's salad. It's a fantastic mix of artichokes, chickpeas, sun dried tomato, and some other seasonings. Prepared in the atmosphere of a super friendly mom and pop shop this place is everything you'd ever want in a quick little lunch.
A good fresh sub sandwich served by very friendly people. Got the Mr. G. They also serve gelato in the summer time.
What's left to say? I've been coming here since it looked like you shouldn't be allowed inside. Fresh sliced meats with amazing bread. What's not to like!? Spicy Italian all day.

I was planning a party and was looking for a nice Antipasto tray for my guests.  I found J.P. Graziano and I saw the great reviews that they already have.  So I called the store and Jim was super nice.  I told him what I was looking for and that I have around 30 guests and he wanted to know more details, so he could advise me if I should go for the medium or large tray.  We both decided that the large one was what I needed and he was flexible to let me extra meats.  I let him decide which cheese to choose from and he made great choices.  The tray was delivered on time and Jim also sent me a cute and sweet gift and a thank you note.   I love the fact that he made me feel so welcome and special as a customer.  This is what I love about a family owned business: they really care about their costumers.  Cant wait to have a new event and to order with J.P. Graziano. Thank you Jim!!

Walked here for lunch while visiting a friend in Chicago. Lots of people came in and out and got sandwiches to-go. I stayed inside to warm up and sat at one of two tables. I ordered the Italian sandwich. It was great, but could've used some hot peppers or giardiniera. I wish I would have added them to my sandwich. The bread was fresh and had a crispy outside but soft inside; perfection! Everyone working there was super friendly and genuinely cared about the food and service they give. They've been open for many, many years and I see why. I'll be back next time I'm in Chicago!
I can't say how good the sandwiches are here.  My favorite is the prosciutto, but the Italian and Mr G are great too. This is my favorite place in the west loop.

Excellent service. I got the tuna sandwich... It was awesome!! I'm sure I'm commuting Italian blasphemy here... But my only complaint is the bread wasn't toasted and it was a bit dry. But it was one of the best sandwiches ever!
Awesome sandwiches. Tuna is great - not loaded with mayo. Staff is super friendly.... Great service.
Mama Mia! Great place!!! Old fashion Italian place for subs... I had the mr G pretty good and I had a cannoli! The Bomb... The staff is awesome and it's family run.
4.5 stars We ate an Italian sub here.  It was perfect! I would totally eat here again.  Also the employees were really friendly.  The outdoor seating is cute.

Honestly the best sandwich I have ever tasted.  The bread is so fresh and words cannot describe how much I adore the spicy Giardiniera (spelling?) which is my new-found love in Chicago.  I ordered the "Spicy" and it was fabulous. I plan on trying every sandwich on the menu here.  To hell with my gluten free tendencies!  This place is worth breaking rules for!  I am grateful that it's only 5 blocks from my apartment!
Three words: go here always. This is hands down the best sandwich joint in the city and the Graziano family is amazing. An absolute must if you're craving a good Italian sub.

My husband and I visited Chicago for a long weekend and are SO glad we stopped in here for subs. The Italian sub is incredible! Fresh toppings with decadent meats and the bread is the perfect amount of crunch and softness. The staff were so kind during our visit! Thankful to see family businesses still in operation. Do yourself a favor and stop in for a sub. Very large portions, one sub could be shared, but because you rarely find a sub of this quality get your own!!
True Italian deli - get the Mr. G! Delish and great quick service to boot. Only wished there were more tables to eat in, and wish we had time to try the fresh cheese and olives!

Stopped through JP's for a quick sandwich last weekend and came away impressed - the sandwiches: meat, cheese, bread, etc. are all sliced/prepared upon order and a full sandwich (~$8-10) is a pretty good size. Extra points for being able to purchase spices by the pound, and don't forget to order the cheesy focaccia if you need a snack later.

I drove 120 miles form Indiana for some subs. After hearing nothing but good things about this place, I had to try it. This place is the holy grail of sandwiches! I got a Mr.G and a hot Italian. I had planned to take them home to eat, however after one bite that plan went out the window. picture me on 94 going 70 mph with a sub in hand. That's what happened. I had both of them gone by the time I got to the state line!! If you want sub perfection stop here!!! Also the nicest bunch of people you will ever meet!!

This place encompasses the beauty of family business, and being Italian. I feel like everyone who works there is in the mafia, and they just know how to make the world's best sandwich as well. One of my favorite places in Chicago. GO! But don't go when I go, because I hate how long the lines are already.
I'm a fan! I had the italian and it was great. It's just really good and they have a nice seating area outside. I'll be returning!

I had an antipasto and a Mr G the other day. I had 1/2 of each and saved the extra halves for the next day.  WOW, the antipasto sub was AWESOME! So was the Mr. G! The flavors and how fresh it was made my day. A night in the fridge made it seem even better the next day! I'm drooling 'til I'll be back downtown to order more!!

This is the place! These sandwiches are really well balanced. It's rare in a sub that you're able to taste all of the ingredients. They take a lot of care in their sandwich assembly. From the bread to their choice of meats and cheeses this place cares and it shows. My favorite sandwich in the city.

Easily a top contender for best subs in Chicago. I actually prefer these subs to Bari. They both get their bread from Damato's, but there's just something about these subs. Cant go wrong with the Turkey. You also get a punch card that gets you a free sub after 10 orders.

Perfecto!! Came in from out of town for my birthday and loved everything about it! High quality ingredients and awesome service! Sandwich is a perfect balance of ingredients. Thanks for the birthday cannoli!! So good! Always recommend this place !

Stopped in to JP Graziano's at lunch for a sub sandwich, and loved it. It's easy to imagine how this area was decades ago, as Graziano's is serving up Italian-style subs, selling cooking spices out of the barrel, and offering other Italian imports from a small storefront, while distributing the same from a warehouse in back.  Order your sub from the friendly guy taking orders, let him know if you want everything on the sandwich, with hot peppers, etc. grab a Sanpellegrino soda to go with it from the cooler, then pay the lady in the office booth. The booth reminds me of the booth in the TV show TAXI, and I can imagine lots of Invoices and Purchase Orders passing under the glass in triplicate!  I ordered the Mr. G, and it was excellent! I look forward to bringing my son here, because he Italian subs are his favorite- and I look forward to many lunch visits to this Randolph St. institution.

While this is a bare bones sub shop (not exactly a grocer) it is one of a kind. The tuna sandwich is NOT pre-made and that makes all the difference! You then can elect what you want in it-artichokes, mild or spicy giardinera, roasted red peppers, yum.

My dad grew up going to Tufano's which meant I grew up eating there on a very regular basis.  so, when I read Graziano's would be making an antipasto sandwich based off of Tufano's antipasto, I had to get there...and i couldn't get there fast enough. I can't brag enough about the quality and the freshness and the overall perfection.  Graziano's reminds me of my pops and I know he's with me each and every time of step foot into Tufano's and, now, Graziano's. He'd give 100% approval to everything about Graziano's and I couldn't be happier for those who pour their heart and soul into this establishment. I visit whenever possible and I try to bring someone new each time as I know they'll fall in love with it...just as I have.
Great spot to get a sandwich, staff very nice, food very good.

I am ashamed I have never been to this place before, that is how good it is. Have you ever felt that Chicago does not have any "great" sandwich places, go to J.P. and you will not feel that way ever again.  Going into this place you feel like you have stepped out of the city and into a different country. I ordered the Mr G. and loved every bite of it. I was literally sad when I realized I had none left.  If this place was not so far from my office, I would make this a regular lunch spot. A++
i am a sandwich fanatic.. and boy oh boy am i beyond happy to have found this place!! Fresh & Great!! Staff is very welcoming as well.. awesome awesome awesome.. dare i say AWESOME!

Graziano's is definitely one of the best spots in the West Loop.  All of their food is super fresh, yummy, and is made with love.  Make sure to get the spicy peppers added to any sandwich you get.  They're super delicious! Apart from the awesome sandwiches, they also have a small, but good selection of Italian products--olive oil, pasta, sauces, honey... This place is family owned, and everyone who works there is a sweetheart.  Whether you're a first time costumer, or a frequent goer, they're always very welcoming.

Not much of a grocery store for you everyday needs but it appeared to have a lot of Italian groceries. We did not go to shop though, we went to eat!. The sandwiches are amazing! I had the Prosciutto and I HIGHLY recommend it. The fresh basil, creamy mozzarella and salty prosciutto was perfect. My bf had the Italian and he thought it was great too!

I can't say enough great things about this place and the family that operates it.   The subs are some of the best in Chicago.  The Mr. G and Prosciutto are particularly great, but it's the Tuna Hot that I can't get enough of.  It defies the law of diminishing returns. And to top it off, the Grazianos are some of the friendliest people you'll ever meet.
Fabulous for what it is: an inexpensive, great sandwich made with terrific ingredients and a family vibe.

The subs here are as good as it gets.  If it's nice out there is seating outside, otherwise plan on taking it to go as there are only a couple of small tables inside.  Order as soon as you walk in the door, walk to the back to pay, then head back up front to pick up your food.  Don't forget the cannoli for dessert; they're delicious!
This place is great! i have never been disappointed. The tuna is made to order MMMM!!!! thanks guys!!

The service here is insanely wonderful. I go here for sandwiches on a weekly basis and every time it feels like I am walking into my family's house. They care about their customers and the food they're serving. I get the tuna sub since each one is made to order and it has all sorts of interesting ingredients. I also like that they host local vendors at their space for tastings. Come here for sandwiches or high-quality Italian ingredients. You won't be disappointed!

I was so moved by their subs that I needed to create an ode to their restaurant through haiku. Giardinara, bliss Catching all crumbs from the fresh bread The Nonna adds laughter The end. I apologize for my inability to make this a true ode or haiku for the poets out there.
Awesome sandwiches!  Best in the city.  And I love the atmosphere of the place.  Not a sit & dine place.  Total old school.  Get the Mr G!

CHICAGO: Best sandwiches around, with locally baked bread brought in daily.  These really knocked my socks off, all the way to 5 stars. The Italian Sandwich (4 stars):  delicious classic Italian sandwich, fresh breads, delicious meats, great veggies, the works.  One of the finest you will have.  Mr G. Sandwich (5 Stars): Mindblowing.  Amazing.  Basil, pickled olive sauce, artichokes, Parmesan, amazing cuts of meat, it was spicy and aromatic; complex and flavorful.  Unique and highly memorable.  SO looking forward to having another one soon.

I think it's really hard to impress with a sandwich, but for whatever reason, this place is fantastic.  Affordable, delicious sandwiches. I've ordered a couple different ones, and I've never had anything close to bad. Great customer service and the people who've rang me up are always super nice and make me want to keep coming back.  I wish there was more I could say about this place, but talking about sandwiches is hard to go on and on about. That, and I'm hungry now.

Just want to reaffirm my love for this place! The spicy is my current favorite, with fresh mozzarella instead of provolone. Reminds me of home, the Italian delis in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn. Also, I went while on a vegan diet and found that the artichoke sammy sans cheese was just divine. Maybe I'll add giardiniera next time...

They make a solid sub sandwich. Fairly close to a New England style grinder. I had the spicy Italian and I have been back twice to get the same sandwich. Would recommend it to anyone looking for a sub fix in the city!

Sandwiches are great and they carry imported products from Italy that you cannot find in your local grocery store. Family owned and everyone is very nice! In the Summer, they open up their outdoor patio to enjoy a lunch. Buon appetito!
Favorite Italian deli in Chicago.. Beats out Tonys or Bari and day! Mr G and the Tuna are the go to's!

Try the Prosciutto. I like them all but keep coming back to it. Now that our office moved, we can't walk over but still order occasionally for delivery. Just go. It's good. Try to time it a little off peak else you'll be waiting in a line at lunch time (but at least the line moves relatively fast).

Fantastic west loop lunch spot.. Classic Italian/American subs with dat old school Chicago vibe.Their  Mr. G is that new new hot fire. Great place for sausages/ cold cuts and cheeses that will impress your friends and family. Don't forget to ask for extra truffle mustard.. You will want more.
