This place is as good as it gets.  Best italian sammy in the city, great deli items, and above all, top notch service.  You will not find a better sandwich from nicer people anywhere in the city.

I'm a bit of a sub/grinder/hero, whatever you call a sandwich, snob and I love this place...I moved to Chicago about 4 years and found this spot recently. I needed a go to sub shop and now I have it. Thank Graziano's.

Authentic Italian sandwich shop was the lure.   As part of my (hopeless?) quest to make work more bearable, I've started taking Divvy bikes to interesting sounding/nearby lunch spots that are too far to walk to, but very doable on a bike from the loop.   It's far smaller than I expected.  They make sandwiches on the right hand side, sell sodas and chips and such to the left and a bit further back there are a few Italian food items.  Pasta, salami, cheese etc.  This is the grocery part, I gather.  The whole joint is the size of maybe 20 cubicles.   They really don't offer a ton of stuff here.  Seems like over the years they've narrowed it down to what sells.  Grandmas lasagna and Uncle Pete's beef jerky didn't make the cut evidently.  I ordered the Mr. G sandwich, which is their house specialty.  It has infinity kinds of meats and provolone cheese.    It's about a foot long, and not too thick.  I give it a B+.  The meat seems to be good quality.  Better than pot belly I'm sure You pay 'at the window' which is a walled off booth in the back.  Weird setup.   I think this area doubles as an office.   I'd guess that some of the people working here are actually part of the family that owns the place.  You defiantly don't see that too often in the loop.   All in all, worth the trip.
This place is so amazing. The food is out of this world good and the service is outstanding.  I had the cheesy focaccia and a Mr. G sandwich and they were both so so so good.

Great spot to grab a sandwich if you are in the area and looking for something quick. They make it right infront of you with fresh ingredients and freshly baked italian bread. The tuna and prosciutto are my favorite. GET THE ITALIAN GIARDINIERA. Either mild or hot, because that makes the sandwich. It's nothing special without it. The older woman behind the register is an absolute sweetheart!
This is a great spot, great sandwiches! Line moves rather fast.  I'm giving this place 4 stars over 5 because its my 2nd favorite sandwich spot in the city.  The first being Bari on grand ave.

I've been coming to this place for years, ever since I've been stationed in the West Loop for work.  The quality of the ingredients is as good as it gets.  Best sandwiches in the area, hands down.  The Mr.G. is great but don't forget about less pricey sandwiches like the Spicy or the Italian. Years ago one of the typical guys who worked there left for whatever reason and they replaced him. The new guy wasn't very good and I received a sandwich that was definitely not the norm. I called up and asked if they changed something about it and Mrs. Graziano said no but she was happy I called with the feedback. She then drove a new sandwich out to me! I definitely didn't expect or even want that but she insisted. Ever since then Mrs. Graziano, her son Jim and his sister smile and welcome me in. They never forget even if it's been months since the last time I made the walk. The cannoli is awesome and they carry certain cheeses you wouldn't get elsewhere. Even after renovation a few years ago they kept with the simple spirit of things, no need for a fancy show. The food speaks for itself.

JP Graziano is the absolute best! We just placed a catering order for the first time 2 weeks ago and everything came packaged perfectly. The food was delicious and the customer service was phenomenal. Since our initial order a few weeks ago, I have placed others, and the woman who answers the phones and takes the orders is just as sweet as pie. You can tell this shop cares a lot about it's products and customers. Highly recommend!
Thank you all for the great Sub.  Everyone was very nice, the place has great charm.  Ill be back soon.

Been here twice and I don't see what the hype is about.  Sandwiches are fairly bland, even the Mr. G's didn't have much going for it that I haven't had before.  Seems like a lot of people are all about the truffle mustard but that doesn't make the sandwich at all. Last time I went the wife and I had the prosciutto and the veggie sandwich.  There was zero flavor in those sandwiches. I really didn't get it.  I have much better and similar sandwiches at Piatto Pronto in Andersonville....and cheaper. I also heard about the gelato was something not to be missed but the cooler was pretty much empty and the gelato that was left looked old and over frozen.   Don't see any reason to go back but I'm glad I checked it out.

I walked a mile from work for my first visit. As a native New Yorker, I'm a tough critic of Italian sandwiches, so I wanted to see how this one measured up. I walked inside and saw it was no frills, no gimmicks. One big room with two tables, the ordering station, the office, the fridge cases, the gelato station, the shelves stocked of Italian specialties; that's basically it. I ordered a Mr. G's sandwich with salami, prosciutto, sopprasetta, sharp provolone, marinated artichoke hearts, fresh basil, lettuce, hot oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, and their truffle mustard balsamic vinaigrette. For another 75 cents, I also added roasted red peppers and mild giardinera. With a Sprite and cannoli, my total came to $14, which may seem a little high, but I'm fine with paying extra three or four dollars for more authentic ingredients. I paid my tab at the infamous ordering office. I told Mrs. Graziano it was my first time and she was happy to introduce herself to me and she shook my hand. That's the type of service that I appreciate so much; it's become all too rare nowadays. I mentioned I also wanted a cannoli and the staff quickly bagged one up for me. I took my first bite of the Mr. G and couldn't believe it. The bread was hard and on the outside, yet incredibly soft inside. I've had so many sub sandwiches on mediocre bread and that ruins the rest of the sandwich. This was definitely not the case. All the ingredients tasted so fresh and I loved the balance of this sandwich. The freshness of the basil, the heat of the oil, the coolness of the artichokes, the spices of the meats. Everything came together so well.  It isn't the easiest walk from my office, but there is no doubt I would return for another sandwich. I just wish they were open till 6 instead of 5 so I could drop by after work for a stellar take-home dinner.

I love this place.  The Food is absolutely delicious.  If I could eat lunch here everyday I would. The food is fresh bottom line.  The meats are are fantastic. They slice everything to order.  The proscuitto and mozzarella is my fav.   They also have fresh cheeses, pasta, bread for sale.  You can also pick up cured salamis and olive oil.   its a great place to get an amazing sandwich. the service is great, friendly and welcoming!  Get your butt over there and have a sandwich.

Fresh, Fresh, Fresh! This place is busy, but they move quick! The sammies are always made on the spot and tasty! They also deliver if you call a day or two ahead! Soups are also good, and the dessert bars are yummy! The interior is old school Italian village deli with friendly Brooklyn accented owners!
I got the Mr. G since everyone says it's the best, but I only thought it was good, not great. A lot of bread without a lot of filling. I'm going to try the Tuna or Italian next time.

I went here for the first time last week.  I read the yelp reviews ahead of time, so I called ahead figuring there would be a long wait, and was told that it would take a half hour. I arrived about twenty minutes later to find my sandwiches already made.  These made me happy, but I was BLOWN AWAY by how wonderfully NICE everyone was.  I was greeted by every person working there, someone ran over to help me as soon as I walked in -- I felt like I was a regular there.  I was in and out in less than five minutes. Our sandwiches were very good.  I love a good italian sandwich, and my boyfriend got the Mr. G, which is the house special.  I would give them five stars for service, but I found like I like Bari's subs better, which are a few bucks cheaper.  My two sandwiches, no sides, came out to $17.  Not bad, but not as cheap as Bari's. All in all, great experience, and I will definitely be back!

I've had a few genuinely lovely experiences here that go beyond the delicious sandwiches that this place is well known for; but my respectful appreciation of this commercial grocery didn't start out smoothly.   From her first experience, the Wife hasn't been shy about publicly extolling her love of a certain Mr. G.  Naturally, I became defensive and jealous of her adoration over this hunky Italian delight.  She's always talked about her affinity towards all things Italian and much of what she loves about  it doesn't equate to me in any way. With hurt pride and an uncontrollable urge to confront my new found nemesis and see what all the big fuss is about, I strode right into this old-timey shop along Randolph to find a clean butcher-style counter and a large doorway leading back to a temperature controlled back room. Being a little confused and anxious about the prospects of getting my angry hands on this Mr. G, I demanded from the guys behind the deli counter to give him up. That's when they tell me I have to speak "to her"... "Her" being a woman behind a counter, inside a little office tucked back in the corner of the front shop.  No way could the home wrecker Mr. G be misconstrued for this kind-looking woman who greets me immediately with words that from some people seem condescending, but from her are sweet gestures of appreciation that you are in her place and buying her products.  Still, she wanted money before I could see this Mr. G.  At this point, the anticipation was too much for me to walk away.  I had to see this elusive object of desire my wife had lusted over.  If it takes a small transaction price for me to set my eyes on Mr. G and do what needed to be done, then so be it.  When in Rome... And that's when it happened.  A short encounter with this Mr. G lead to my fear and jealousy and feelings of inadequacy somehow vanishing almost instantly and being replaced with deep respect, admiration and dare I say- love.  How could I be upset with my wife for wanting something that I myself now crave, dream about, and make plans for?  It dawned on me that living my life in a jealous nature is no way to live at all, especially when the thing that I became so jealous of has come to bring me such ethereal pleasure. I now loudly profess my undying love for Mr. G, and I frequently do so alongside my wife.  Clearly our lives have been changed by this delicious sandwich made with hot sopresatta, provolone, Prosciutto di Parma, salami, truffled mustard, some veggies and a bit of vinegar and oil all encased by a nicely baked long roll.  Really, the only thing I can say is that if you head here, you'll definitely want to get your hands on Mr. G and stuff it all in your mouth. Yep, I said it - and I'm not ashamed. And while this may (or may not) make Mrs. Graziano (the amazing "boss" back in that corner office) uncomfortable, the real reason I write this review is about her.  Yes, the sandwiches are astounding.  Yes, this place has been around since the 30's.  Yes, its a great blend of both tradition and American.  But what makes this place endearing to me is Mrs. Graziano, and the last couple of visits I've had here dealing with her. Walking in after work, but only 20 minutes before closing time, I happened to notice I couldn't find the canollis which are usually in the standing cooler.  Thinking that perhaps I just missed them or that they had some more in the back, I asked Mrs. Graziano.  She said "let me check back here for you" and got up and walked behind a back counter.  She then proceeded to get out everything necessary to make two canollis for me to go home 20 minutes before they closed shop.  I insisted that I was asking for too much and that she didn't need to go through the trouble, but she counter-insisted on providing me with two customized canollis for my wife and I to take home and enjoy.  And we did.  And we were very grateful. But maybe not as grateful as we were upon acting on her suggestion to mix some of J.P. Graziano's very own giardenaire with a cut of beef (I used chuck roast) in a crock pot and put on a low setting until it tears apart (looking like pulled pork) giving you an outrageously easy and delicious beef mixture that is perfect in so many applications.  In a bun as a sandwich.  Mixed with some fresh steamed vegetables and egg noodles.  On top of fresh sliced bread with some sliced tomato bruschetta-style.  In your morning smoothie.  It don't matter.  The stuff is amazing- and yet another reason why Mr. G, Mrs. Graziano, and the entire institution of J.P. Graziano Grocery has rightfully earned my adoration.

I have been wanting to eat here for quite some time. On Friday I was in town to meet some friends for lunch at The Little Goat. They missed there train so I had an extra long time to wait for them. I decided to eat a pre lunch in the form of a Mr. G sub. Although bread to meat ratio may look off the Grazianos obviously know what they're doing because the flavors were perfectly balanced. I was happy the bread did not scrape the roof of my mouth. It was surprisingly light for a sandwich. I wanted to order so many more things. What makes this place amazing is the hominess as soon as you walk in. They greet and treat you like a long time friend or their own family. You can tell some people come several times a week. This family cares about the food they put out and have a lot of love to give as well. They actually care. You leave with warm fuzzies and a full belly.  Thanks for having me! I shall be back.

How.  In the hell.  Have I never.  Been.  Here.  Before?????!? Seriously. I've lived here for six years and until yesterday, I had no clue this place existed. I grew up in New York.  I grew up surrounded by the best - BEST - Italian food outside of Italy.  These sandwiches rival ANY New York deli.   I'm looking at their take-home menu on my coffee table.  It says, "You've never had it this good!" I know, flyer.  I know. I haven't. Rather, I hadn't.   Until yesterday. Go.  Eat a Mr. G.   Or anything. It's all good. And say, "Hi" to Mrs. G for me.   She's the best. Actually, the whole family rocks. So, go.  And support them.  Because they're amazing. And so is their food.
This place is still my favorite lunch spot in the city. The new gelato that they have is absolutely amazing. Better than any gelato I've had anywhere else including Italy.

I visited this grocer yesterday to pick up some cheese and olives for a dinner party. Quite honestly, the best fresh ricotta and I can't recall the other kind if cheese I have ever had. Also, the honey and olives and Danny's macaroons were all fantastic. The best part of my visit was the top notch knowledge and service that we received. Oh we also tried the gelato and bought some-it is the best. I will definitely return here& I am Italian so it is hard to impress me!

I've only had their turkey sandwich and it was love at first bite!  I've heard great things about all their other sandwiches and always make a plan to try a new sandwich, but my pulse starts racing the second it's my turn to order and I always end up with my main squeeze, the turkey. If they were to open another location in Lincoln Square, I would never have to make my own dinner again!
Love the Italian, but you need to order with extra red wine vinegar/olive oil to get my tip wet if you know what I mean
Best deli sandwiches and Italian specialty food spots in the city. Four generations at the same location.

The very best of the best- a great neighborhood spot with tons of awesome family history, the friendliest proprietors and the freshest ingredients. My husband and I have to curb our cravings for both the Tuna and Mr. G subs- and their truffle mustard vinaigrette is great on any sandwich. The West Loop is lucky to have JP Graziano's as a staple!
Great sandwiches! I had the fresh mozeralla and basil and found it very refreshing on a hot day. Takes a minute to figure out the joint your first time there.

Delicious, delectable sandwiches at a fair price as well as some of the finest cannoli that I've ever eaten. Their Italian sub: excellent quality meats, fresh bread and a very well judged ratio of oil-vinegar-giardiniera on top, I'm drooling as I type. Also very friendly service to boot!

Love love love the Mr. G sub. The sandwiches here have the perfect balance of crusty bread and tasty toppings. The Mr. G has delicious italian meats, huge artichokes, fresh basil, and TRUFFLE MUSTARD!!! It is the perfect combination on a sandwich. Make sure you know what you want when you step up to order - regulars know the routine and can get snippy with people who don't know when they're doing. Then go pay "ma" at the window. make sure you get a cannoli, because theyre delicious!

Yum, yum, yum.  Meats and breads and imported groceries and cannolis, oh my! I had the Mr. G, and it was pretty fantastic.  The only downside was that we had to wait for-ever after ordering, almost a half hour, to get our sandwiches.  They were busy as it was around lunch time, but it was felt like an unreasonable amount of time to wait for a deli sandwich!   Perhaps they were understaffed for the day.  Anyway, it was worth the wait.  They aren't cheap but they sure are good.  Love the other groceries they have as well.  Especially love that it's 3 blocks from work.  Staff was very friendly and the space has a nice feel.  Overall very positive experience!

Hands down best tuna sub I've had in Chicago! This place is a fantastic, family owned sandwich place. It's sort of hidden because the old and weary sign in the front does not indicate the quality of the food or the service. When first coming in I am always greeted warmly by the staff, and the service continues as they charge you later and when they follow up to see if you're enjoying your sandwich. You can request customizations to your sandwiches but it's close to perfection the way it is on the menu. The ingredients all taste fresh and the sandwich is big enough to satisfy my impossibly insatiable hunger. The bread is great, it's like a french baguett only much thicker, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, the way a sandwich bread should be. I came back to this place multiple times and will continue to do so in the future. Favorite.

Puhleeeeeeeeeease open a location in the loooooooop.  I'm not a huge connoisseur of Italian subs but these sandwiches are definitely da bomb in terms of quality ingredients, flavor, and size.  I tried the made to order tuna and it was probably the freshest tuna salad sandwich I've had. The addition of the giadirienindiedar (sp?) is super. I tried to mild this time but would venture into the hot next time.  Also tried the veggie sandwich and it was packed with delicious eggplant, tomatoes, and a large basil leaf. I also added the truffle vinaigrette to it and it was very tasty.  My one con is I spotted some Italian savory crackers by the register and they were not marked with a price. Mrs. Graziano (I think) rang me up and the small bag of crackers turned out to be 10 DOLLARS. What?!? Wish she would have warned me.  Overall great place I'd definitely come back and try the other sandwiches!

It was our very first visit, and Mrs. Graziano took time out of her busy Saturday to introduce herself and shake our hands individually to welcome us to her shop. I don't think I've ever felt such a warmth and sense of engagement from any establishment before, let alone one whose products speak for themselves! I'm not even a sandwich lover, generally speaking, and I polished off a prosciutto sub like it was nothing. Definitely go here if you want an experience that feels 100% genuine in both cuisine and atmosphere.

Decent sandwich, decent bread. Small Selection of large jars of stuff and bulk spices. Understood that to some it's an institution. I just miss my old Italian Deli back home. Two lonely balls of Scamorza in a reach-in made me long for the old times.

Best sandwich shop in the West Loop. Food is super fresh, meat is sliced in front of you, and the service is great. Family owned and the owners are the nicest people ever!! I highly recommend Graziano's for a great meal!!!

These are the nicest people in the world and they reward loyalty through LevelUp and Stampt.  The sandwiches leave you full and the cannoli for dessert is a nice treat.  The store is full of all kinds of extras from olives to bread crumbs.  Every time I go in here I find something I like.  But most of all the people!

This place is nothing short of spectacular. My first visit there was perhaps the best food shopping experience I have ever had.  First off, this place is family owned and operated, and they have a love and passion for the food they sell. We went in looking for high quality meats and cheeses for four different pizzas we were making that evening.  The family was incredibly helpful and friendly through the process, helping us choose the best items for our purposes.  They let us try everything, which more than sold us once we tasted what they had to offer.  The ricotta was probably the best dairy product I have ever put in my mouth.  We were able to purchase everything in the exact quantities we needed, which was great...none of that great food went to waste. On our second visit, the family remembered us and asked us how our pizzas turned out.  I would give this place 6 stars if I could.  I will be back many more times!

I'm not sure I should give this hidden gem yet another positive review.    The lines for lunch are long enough as it is, and I'd hate for Graziano's to become too famous. But I just can't help but crow about the sandwiches.   Every one is a masterpiece.    Love the italian meats.   But believe it or not, the vegetarian is my favorite.    I have them add onions (which aren't included by default). I haven't tried their cannoli yet, but I did have one of their biscotti today -- and it was delicious.    They have a few other snacks and grocery items I'd like to try.    But I'm always so full after eating one of their sandwiches. Getting hungry just thinking about it.

I NEVER order tuna.  Not because I don't like tuna.  In fact, I love tuna but I hate how restaurants typically have their tuna salad pre-mix and usually accompanied by copious amounts of mayo.  So what did I order?  Tuna sub because J.P.'s makes em to order.   When I walked it I was greeted right away by staff working the front counter, it wasn't a peak hour so it wasn't super busy.  I placed my tuna sub order made with light-light mayo and the works; red peppers, celery, onion, artichoke, giardiniera (I did mild...next time I'd do hot), lettuce, provolone & tomato.  Then made my way farther into the deli/shop to pay at back window counter.  Moments later my to-go was handed to me. Three word phrases came to mind as I ate my sub:  It' s.so .BIG.  I'm gonna eatcha.   oh.my .God.  You so tasty.  I love you.  Yum Yum Yum. Going, going, gone.

Been eating the italian sandwiches of Chicago and the burbs for close to 40 years now.   There are legendary Italian subs in Chicago.  ...J.P. Graziano's tops this list.  Everything from the charm, to the service, to the products, to the sandwiches.  Best of the best.   Tim Drover

My wife and I decided to have lunch at J.P. Graziano's earlier this week because the wait at Publican Quality Meats was unbearable.  We had seen this place featured on Chicago's Best, so we were interested in trying one of their Italian subs for ourselves.  We ended up ordering a Mr. G and a vegetarian sandwich.  Both sandwiches were AMAZING!  The portions are very large, but I could not resist the temptation to finish my entire sandwich AND half of my wife's sandwich.  It was THAT good.  As other reviewers have mentioned, the bread is a little hard (kinda like eating a bowl of Captain Crunch) but goes very well with the meats and cheeses that they use.  The guys that run the place are friendly and helpful.  We had some difficulty figuring out where to pay, but other than that, it was a great GREAT lunch experience.  We'll defiinitely be back.

Holly cow this place makes one hell of a of an Italian sub.  I've been hearing about this place from time to time from friends.  Always thought I would hit it for a sub if I was around Randolph at lunch.  7+ years it didn't happen.  Thursday I meet a buddy for lunch in the west loop and the place we had been hitting for sushi for almost 10 years closed... so we wandered aimlessly trying to think of a place to hit.  Wandered in here after Little Goat told us 30 minute wait at 11:45.  Kitty corner to Little G so we wandered over to grab a sandwich.  Only two tables so plan on taking it to go.  Bar bones place but man this is the best Italian in the whole city and I have hit a fair amount of locations.  Wander over to Milwaukee for 2nd best.   Fresh Italian bread, just the right amount of outer crisp and inner moist chewy.  The cured meats were top quality and fresh, great hot peppers, good cheese.  I'm going to be a regular here moving forward.  If you're not a big eater you could split one between two people.  Cheap as well as the sandwich was $6.25.  We grabbed them to go and ate at a park about 3 blocks south that had tables as it was pretty nice out considering how the weather has been in the Spring so far. About 6 sandwiches and Italian groceries if you want anything.  Next one to try is Publican market to see how it compares Put this on your list to try!

Alright...the taste test has concluded.  I officially tried Vinnies, Bari, and J.P. J.P. was pretty good...however it didnt take the title in my book.  It came in second. The bread here is a little harder than I am used to.  Its like a Milano bun if you have ever had that.   I had the veggie and the italian.  Now, both were good, and I wouldnt complain if anyone wanted to go here again BUT there is a better sandwich shop.  The veggies did have flavor but not as much as my fav sandwich shop. The staff here is awesome though.  Three dudes making up the sandwiches and they have great personality.  I will go back just to see them. Its a cheap lunch/dinner spot.  Oh and dont forget, there's authentic groceries in there as well :)

You need to have plenty of time to wait. There are only a couple of guys making sandwiches and the line is always long -- but oh so worth it. Every sandwich I have had here makes me want to wax poetic about Graziano's as a whole. My favorites: the Mr. G, the Prosciutto, and the Veggie (eggplant on a sandwich should be mandatory). Come here, do a little shopping in the grocery section, order a sandwich and a cannoli and it's a meal fit for anyone. Unless you don't like cannoli and that just makes me sad.

Delicious subs in a wide variety of options.  I started going here 4 years ago back when they charged practically nothing for sandwiches. They have since started charging fair market price, but it is still an excellent value. It's also a lot more busy these days, but...still worth it. Try: Prosciutto and mozzarella Tuna with accoutrements  TBM
I love love LOVE this place. Saw it on Chicago's Best awhile ago and just had to check it out. I've had many sub sandwiches but JP has THE best Italian I've ever had! No other places come close.

Awesome sandwich shop in the west loop specializing in fine italian meats.  They have about 10 sandwich choices to choose from and i get their special, the Mr G that is too freaking good.  Definitely more of a to-go place as there are only 2 small tables inside.  Just go.

J.P. Graziano is an excellent example of the classic Chicago Italian sub, along with various other J.P. Graziano specialty subs.  On this visit, we arrived around 10:00 AM on a Monday morning, and luckily there was no wait.  There are two tables to sit at and enjoy your freshly made to order subs.  The subs are served on very fresh and very crunchy D'Amato's bakery bread from nearby on Grand Ave.  D'Amato's crunchy bread is the best in the business, even if it doesn't necessarily add anything to the actual taste of the subs.  If you're into crunchy bread, then any sub sandwich with D'Amato's bread is right up your alley.  And fresh cannoli's, too.   We enjoyed 3 subs- the classic Italian, the house specialty "Mr. G,"  and a turkey sub.  The turkey sub consists of a turkey breast, provolone cheese, roasted red pepper, mayo, tomato, and lettuce.  Simply put- this was probably the best turkey sub I've ever tried.  Truly excellent in every way.  The turkey had a mesquite flavor, and it very much stood out on its' own.  Their turkey sub alone is reason enough to abandon every other sandwich shop in the West Loop.  A perfect 5 stars.   The house specialty, the "Mr. G,"  consists of sharp imported provolone, hot supressata, prosciutto di parma, volpi genoa salami, truffle mustard balsamic vinaigrette, hot oil, marinated roman style artichoke, fresh basil, lettuce with red wine vinegar, and oregano.  That's a lot going on for a sandwich, but it was actually really easy to eat.  The meats are cut very thin, and somehow, someway, this sub comes out on the light side.  The fresh basil and the marinated roman style artichoke made this sub for me.  Very good.   And then there was the Italian- hot capicola, volpi genoa salami, hard salami, mortadella, provolone, tomato, lettuce with red wine vinegar, and oregano.  Another excellent sub, and definitely better than their local competition over at Bari on Grand Ave.  The meats are sliced thinner at J.P. Graziano compared to Bari, and J.P. Graziano's meats flat out taste better.  Although I wish they would use the sharp imported provolone that 's used on the "Mr. G"  rather than the regular provolone because the regular provolone kind of gets lost in the mix of the truly outstanding/fresh meats at J.P. Graziano.   In short, this is the best Italian sub I've ever had within the actual city limits of Chicago, and if I lived closer to the West Loop, I'd easily abandon Bari on Grand Ave.  for J.P. Graziano's.  It's an excellent version of a classic Chicago Italian sub, but not quite as good as Alpine in Elmwood Park or Al and Joe's in Franklin Park which are my only 5 star Italian sub/Italian grocery stores.  Both Alpine and Al and Joe's use softer Gonnella bread, but Alpine and Al and Joe's have better housemade oil and vinegar mixes that, for whatever reason, taste better than J.P. Graziano's.  Maybe that's because Alpine and Al and Joe's use softer breads that soak up the oil and vinegar mixes?!?!?  And the sharper aged provolone at Al and Joe's is still better than everybody else's.   For anyone looking for an excellent Italian sub sandwich, and definitely the best turkey sub you'll ever have anywhere, go to J.P. Graziano's in the West Loop.  And the owner, Jim Graziano, Jr.  is very nice and very accommodating to whatever needs you may have.                                           Great experience all the way around.

Easily my favorite place to snag an Italian sub on the weekend.  Fantastic, family-oriented service. Huge, delicious subs. All in all, it's nice to know there's still a humble establishment on restaurant row.  If you'd like to eat in, know that there are only a couple of tables, so you may or may not be able to snag one.
one of the best subs I've ever had. I think of it as a less greasy/oily version of Bari's italian subs. Which one is better? I really can't decide. Just try them both and decide for yourself!
my socks were officially knocked off by the italian sub.  Best i've ever had and the place is great/service is great/staff is very nice.  Will definitely be going back this weekend for another.

This place has THE BEST tuna sub around.  It's made to order with fresh ingredients and I can't get enough.  To top it off, the people working there are so nice and friendly.   Such a great place and everyone should check it out.  Even if it's not in your hood, don't panic....they are now on Grub Hub.

best sandwich shop in the city hands down.  the prosciutto is king.  the italian is delicious, the spicy brings the heat,  and i hear the tuna is fantastic.  the quality of the meats and bread cannot get any better.  some sandwich places have one or the other, but jpg has everything going for them including consistency.  i'm so glad i live close.  i think it's time i take down mr g next.  with peppers of course.

This place is more than a sandwich shop. It's more than a grocery store. It's an experience! If you haven't been here, stop what you're doing and make your way over to 901 W Randolph Street right now. Family owned and run FOREVER, this place is a neighborhood staple. When lunch time comes, there is no other place in the neighborhood I'd rather go. They're slicing meat and cheese on a sandwich by sandwich basis. It doesn't get any fresher than that. I didn't realize meat could be sliced so thin to be honest. Then they pile it high on fresh bread. The bread is so fresh that you can't wait too long to get over there for lunch. Sometimes by 2-3pm they'll run out of their bread. It's hard not to be upset when that happens, but every time I bight into one of their gloriously hand crafted sandwiches I'm reminded what fresh bread is supposed to taste like and realize that if they had ordered more bread, I'd be eating day old bread the next day. The grocery store is an awesome place to stock up on specialty meats and artisan cheeses for parties and gatherings. There's a handful of imported olive oils, fresh pasta, and specialty bottled artichokes and roasted red peppers to choose from as well as everything else you might expect to find. The staff is probably my favorite part of the experience.  They work together as a finely tuned machine. It's extremely fascinating to watch them all work in unison and move through a line of customers snaking out the door and around the corner. I can't say enough good things about this place. Come to think about it, I'm going to head over there for lunch today. I heard they're offering fresh soup now, and I can't wait to check it out.

My husband and brother in law do a lot of eating.  This are their favorite subs in the city.  Affordable, fast, fresh.  Downsides?  None.  None.  Except, maybe, that they tend to be out of commission for a few hours their binges.  But, I suppose that no matter how delicious, the restaurant cannot be blamed for their lack of self-control.

These sandwiches are to die for. The crusty bread is amazing! I always intend to eat just half and then end up eating the whole sandwich, which is large. Added bonus: the owners are super friendly and family oriented. The outside eating area is fun in the summer, too. Highly recommend this place!

I can see why they have such great reviews on yelp. Even with it being super busy, the staff was friendly and on top of things.  The Mr. G (with hot peppers) really rocked. I also noticed a bunch of people grabbing the asiago cheese rolls that had pieces of giardiniera inside it so out of curiousity, I tried it too. The flavor combination of the asiago cheese and the giardiniera was to die for. I could have happily ate 5 of the rolls myself. This is one of those places that I can't resist everytime I'm hanging around the West Loop.

Thanks to this place, I've graduated from getting Italian sandwiches from Jimmy John's! I've gotten the Italian, the Prosciutto, the Tuna...and yes the Mr. G. Every sandwich was excellent - with the Prosciutto being my personal favorite. Fresh tasting ingredients done with consistency every single time. Trust me, I've ordered here a bazillion time, and each time it's done exactly the same way. And there's no other way I'd have it.

Just got myself over to J.P. for muffuletta fixin's and found [most of] what I needed with the help of several friendly, knowledgeable and efficient people manning the store. It's not surprising they've been around for 75 years.

So, after searching through Yelp reviews for a PERFECT deli in the West Loop, I finally decided to venture out in the rain for an Italian sub. Upon entering, I was greeted by the cashier and the sub sandwich superstars! Although it was my first time there, I felt extremely welcomed and I will definitely be back. The sandwich was worth every bit of my cold, rain soaked pants!

I have been going to JP Graziano's once a week for lunch over the past year.  Today I went there to order two subs, one for me, and one for my brother.  The guy taking my order told me I could only have one because he only had enough bread for 10 subs.  Are you kidding me?  How about you just give me the two subs I ordered and then stop taking orders once you run out of bread?  The guy knows who I am because I usually don't even have to order, he just knows what I get.  Good job buddy....refuse to fill a regular customers order.   I will never go back to this place for lunch again.  It's a shame because the lady who runs the cash register is a sweet heart.   Mariano's Fresh Market (opening on Halsted and Monroe) can't come soon enough!

I actually don't work to far from here and was told by some co-workers that this was a must try. I tried the caprese sandwhich which was great, but it is also hard to mess that up. Street parking only and if you go during rush hour lunch it is almost impossible to find something.  There are two tables inside, so don't expect to sit inside.  The prices were reasonable and they were really organized and quick in getting all the orders out. The only waiting I did was to pay because they only have one cashier. They take credit cards too.
Very good subs. I can recommend the italian and the tuna.

My quest for Chicago's greatest Italian style sandwich may have come to an end.  I was killing time biking around the city, hunger struck, and ohhh boyyy was I in luck.  Dont *expletive deleted* up, order the Mr. G. The sandwich is pure bliss. They cover all the bases. Crunchy, fresh, sweet, spicy, salty, AHHHHHH IT'S SOOOOO GOOOOOOD! Fresh basil and tender artichokes are perfect on that sandwich. Wash it all down with their blood orange San pellegrino, if available.  I'd love to get back and buy some groceries, try a salad, and I'm dying to try that Italian chili that has its own picture on here. J.P. Graziano is a sandwich aficionado's wet dream.
omg sooo yummy!! I love this place, its a cute little family owned market the Mr G was delicious I will absolutely be back here again for lunch!

You must try the Mr. G here.  The best sub EVER!  The truffle mustard is out of this world! There's always a line here but it goes pretty fast.  They deliver too.  They also sell some italian grocery here, like spices, pasta, fresh mozz, etc.  A pretty cool place.

I felt like a smug snob that I knew what lardo was and everyone else who wasn't behind the counter didn't... and was asking me about it. We were actually here for dried herbs and spices, which is pretty freaking awesome in and of itself.  However, it was the sheer friendliness of the guys helping us out and the fact that the clientele don't have any reservations in striking up a conversation with a total stranger makes this place stand out.

As Randolph Street becomes more and more of a dining destination, many of the old time warehouse and wholesale places are becoming more consumer friendly and this is true of Garziano's Grocery. The subs have gone up in price and are all about $-9 each (plain) and could run you $10 with oil, peppers, mayo, etc. When you walk in you notice right away that this place seems to be a deli attached to a wholesale operation. They have a small section where they prepare the subs, and sell a small amount of quality cheeses, cold cuts, and olives along with other specialty items. The servers are friendly and crack a joke here and there, and you pay at a little back window after your sub is ready.   I had an Italian and the meat and bread were awesome. The bread is from the D'amato's Bakery on Grand. The subs are priced without condiments, so if you want oil, mayo, hot peppers you are going to pay an extra 25-50 cents per item (seems a little odd that the sandwiches come "plain"). At any rate, the portion size is quite good and the mix of high quality cold cuts, cheese, and D'Amato's bread make these subs a west loop winner. I would rank these subs under the Grand Ave. sub shops and nearby places because of the cost/extras charges, but if you find yourself in the West Loop you can't go wrong here.  The little outside section can be cram-packed if the stroller moms are hogging up space, but everyone understands the place is cramped and I found it was easy to navigate after asking to move a chair here or there. Just be direct and ask if you need someone to scoot! No garbage outside, so I went back in the store to dump my trash in the basket on the inside wall.  I was here NATO Summit weekend and busloads of cops in black riot uniforms came in by the dozens to order subs. As is true in most of Chicago, if the place feeds cops, it has to be good!

Family owned Italian grocery store with a phenomenal deli. The current Graziano that runs the business now loves what he does and it shows in the way he treats the customers and by the quality of the goods.  I have shopped here and had sandwiches. The products are unique and very high quality.  The sandwiches are amazing. I only eat Turkey sandwiches from all deli's but I have gone with people that have tried other sandwiches and they all feel the same way I do. This place ranks up there with Bari and Fontanos IMO.  One qualm I have is the lack of swiss! But it is a true italin shop, so i understand. BUt Turkey and Swiss is my go to. I usually go with the provolone as a replacement.  Anyway, get to this place, you will return.
Short and Sweet: Amazing sandwich shop and incredibly nice owners.  I just wish I lived closer...

When you enter JP Graziano, it smells like happiness. Oh how I love these little gems come straight from the past on street corners that haven't changed that much in decades. Old....it's what I miss the most from Europe. Stumbling across old stones, visiting a medieval church, walking on hundred-year-old cobbled streets....that makes my heart flutter and my head spin. Old is awesome. When you come from a city who's proud of its pre-Roman heritage, it can be brutal to find yourself in Chicago and its forest of skyscrapers and heaps of modern sculptures. But places like J.P. Graziano are there to remind you that the world is not monolithic, it's a colorful mosaic of people of all ages from all around who bring you what you need in the most unexpected moment. Being in business for 80 years old is not small feast, even back home. It means you are doing things well. It means that in your giant containers of cannelini beans, olives and spices, there's also some o' good love. I felt like a fish in the ocean in there, and was marveling at the scarce shelves of products, the large counters, the little register in the back..... And then I got my Mr G, and all the blablablah semi-poetry from above disappeared in matter of seconds when I swallowed my first bite. On my mind, this impossible challenge: find a way to make it last as long as possible while stuffing my face at a steady pace. Flawless bread; meaty as a dream; and cheesy as well; spicy; flavorful; seasoned to perfection. I won't repeat the ingredients, but it's all the glory of Italy in a sandwich. That, really, is "amore". Last but not least: the cashier is so nice and welcoming that you feel like family. I almost wanted to kiss her goodbye. But then I had my sandwich to eat, and didn't have time to waste.

$6.25 for a sandwich with THE BEST QUALITY ingredients.  The snaking line outside the door at any given lunchtime is well deserved.   The bread is crusty, but not dry.  I can actually enjoy this sandwich without a need for a drink.  The Italian meats are INCREDIBLE.  Smooth with texture, not hard-skinned like the commercial stuff you find at most sandwich shops/chains. These must be made in-house. The Mr. G is worth the extra $2.00, but if I had to eat one every day, I'd see it getting played out after one week.  The Italian, spicy or not, can be my lunch for the next several months & I'll still crave it. Next time, I will try the tuna that everyone talks about.....

Seriously.. it's as good as it gets! My friend has been telling me to check this place out for MONTHS! then i finally did and it was literally the best italian sub I've ever had!! I had the made to order tuna and then went back the following week and got the Mr. G.   The place was completely not what i imagined.  One sandwich bar.. wall of dried pasta, italian canned goods, etc.  then other side has a wall of refrigerators that have buckets of delicious olives and other cured meats.. Everyone that works there is super friendly and loved that they work fast!

Oh, this place is wonderful!  I found it by typing "sandwich" into the yelp app on my phone.  I am staying at a hotel four short blocks away and was able to walk to the Graziano Grocery Co. in no time flat.  I loved the friendly greetings that I got from the guys behind the counter and the cashier in the back.  My sub -- a  prosciutto to go -- was absolutely delicious.  I washed it down with a bottle of Chef Luciano's ginger beer, which was fine both as an accompaniment to the sandwich and on its own. If I lived in Chicago, I'd be a regular.  For sure!

Nothing beats walking into J.P. Graziano on a gloomy, rainy day to pick up some sandwiches and being greeted as "sweetheart", and then "honey" and "pretty" at the cashier. When was the last time a "grocery" made you feel so warm and fuzzy? Affectionate (and much appreciated) service aside, this place makes one of my favorite sandwiches ever. Are you ready? Their house speciality, the Mr. G = Sharp imported provolone, hot sopresatta, Prosciutto di Parma, Volpi genoa salami, truffle mustard balsamic vinegrette, hot oil, roman style artichoke, fresh basil, lettuce w/ red wine vinegar & oregano on perfect Italian bread. TRUFFLE MUSTARD BALSAMIC VINEGRETTE, PEOPLE! Sandwiches don't get better than this.  2 small tables if you want to eat in, but people mostly seem to do take out orders (probably so they can secretly eat 2 of these bad boys without being judged - yes, they are THAT good... I sat through Next's Childhood menu with 2 Mr. G's in my bag. That's some serious love.) Don't forget to pick up some important Italian meats, cheeses, olive oil, etc. while you're here!

Very tasty subs. Family loves to come here because it reminds them of the old neighborhood. My dad and mom love the turkey sub with hot peppers. Very high quality meat and cheeses.  I usually order the veggie with no cheese and no tomatoes. Still quite tasty even though the veggies are marinated.  If you are in the area check them out. Much better than settling for Potbellys, Subway, or Quiznos.
You can't go wrong with a Mr. G's sandwich...I get one nearly every Saturday.  Great party trays when you entertain your friends.

LOVE THIS PLACE... I've been using for my Italian staples since I moved in the neighborhood 4+ years ago - not a ton of variety but really great quality meats and cheeses.  This combined with the super convenient N & G Produce across the street and you've got all the fix ins for your great Italian meal.  Must try the asiago cheese rolls made with giardiniera and the sweets too - but please leave a few for me!  The go-to sub is the Mr G - it will make you a believer.   Great family run shop - do your part to keep this gem in the neighborhood!

Simply the best sandwiches available in Chicago, to my knowledge (sorry Conte; you still rock, but you're not this good). I went with the Italian today - the bread was delicious (crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside), the meats were sliced to order, and well-balanced between capicola, mortadella, and salami, the provolone was flavorful, and the lettuce, tomato, and red wine vinegar rounded out the sandwich perfectly. I dropped the ball and forgot to get giardinera; rest assured I will not make this mistake again, as it looked delicious. Cannoli is delicious, with a crunchy yet thick cookie surrounding rich yet refreshing mascarpone. They even sell Arnold Palmers, for $0.99 just like at the Seven Eleven. As far as the pricing, the sandwich is $0.25 more expensive than Subway's Italian, for several orders of magnitude better quality. This might be the perfect eating establishment, no joke; I'll be back and back, and back!

As far as deli sandwiches (subs), J.P. Graziano's is seriously the only place people should go.  J.P. Graziano's is the epitome of a family owned business as the siblings are the ones that make the sandwiches and the mom is behind the cash register. Everything about this place is fresh...from the meats and vegetables to the bread they get from a bakery down the street.  Their famous sandwich is the "Mr. G"; however, my favorite is the Spicy. I also love that you can do buy a few grocery items (mainly condiments) while waiting for your sandwich.

The best place to go for subs in the West Loop!  My favorite is the turkey, but the Mr G. is great also.  A great value for the quality! Stop by here for lunch sometime - this place will snag you out of your mid-day funk!
Chicago lacks quality delis, period.  Graziano's was great.  I got the MR. G, the fresh basil put this sandwich over the top.  So delicious.

SICK ITALIAN SANDWICHES HERE. Never had better in Chicago. It's worth every penny, every minute you wait. This ish is legit. All their ingredients are authentic, imported...homemade (by the Graziano family themselves) - just can't get better than that. I wouldn't recommend another place over this one for italian subs. Calling ahead helps.  I used to eat here 3 out of 5 days of the week because I worked nearby. Never got sick of it. NEVA. The Mr. G is a solid choice. Every time, man. Every time! Add fresh mozz. sickkknessss.
I'm a sucker for great Italian sandwiches. J.P. Graziano has one of the best in Chicago.
Great Italian sub!  One of the better sandwich shops in Chicago.

I used to live in New Jersey/NY area and miss a good, old school, Italian deli. I recently started working in the West Loop so a co worker recommended this place and glad he did. It is exactly what I have been looking for in Chicago. I wish they would open one in my neighborhood because I am so tired of Panera bread and Chipotle but the fact that this place is in the meat packing neighborhood is perfectly fitting. As soon as I walked in, I knew it was going to be good. Unpretentious, really friendly, family owned place. Told one of the guys that I used to live in Jersey and miss a place like this. He was so cool, brought me a generous free sample of some slices of Berkshire Salami that he said is made in Jersey. Stuff was awesome! I have been back two times since in the last week. Definitely recommend the Mr. G, the Italian, and Turkey. Owner said the tuna is fantastic as well, next time. All the sandwiches I had were great. I thought the Mr. G was the best one I tried so far. Have a card or app for your i phone or droid where you get a free sandwich on your 10th visit. Bottom line, great sandwiches, use fresh, Damoto's bread, have a daily soup, have a retail deli with cold cuts and cheeses, and super friendly, family run. Five stars in my book! Please open one in my hood!

We ordered 2 trays of sandwiches for our little Super Bowl bash. Generally they were tasty and it made hosting the game party so easy.  Our guests were happy and had no objections to taking home leftovers.  But I was most impressed with the service.  When I placed the order, they walked me through all of my options very patiently.  When I picked them up, they helped me out to my car.  Everyone was so nice.
Wow what a great place to get a grinder... Best Italian sub I have had on the west side!!! The truffle oil and fresh basil makes it original.. Can't wait to get back for more!

a neighborhood gem - and better than bari and conte! amazing sandwhiches, freshly baked bread, great with giardineras. mama graziano remembers all the repeats customers. fast service, great price.  our go to place for an amazing sandwich.

Very friendly service and good sandwich.  I had the Veggie sandwich and the eggplant included on the sandwich is delicious. The bread was fresh and crunchy, but the lettuce and tomatoes included were disappointing.  I cannot stand shredded lettuce, but I guess that's a personal issue.  I'll be back, but I wouldn't make it an everyday lunch place given the price.  $7.25 + tax for a veggie sandwich is a bit much.

Probably one of the friendliest places i been to in a while.  From the women who takes your order to the lady that you pay. (which is Mama Graziano herself-very cool). So friendly ill be back. You order as you walk in on your right then pay in the back. there is a little seating area on the left as u enter. Lots of open space.  The place reminds me of an old butcher shop. Even the subs are wrapped in that thick paper from way back. Anyway, its a cool place.  So anyway I ordered a Tuna Sub which is made to order. Light mayo, light mild Giardanera everything else. Im not a huge fan of white bread but this was a throw back to when i was a kid and we would make sandwiches on French. Crispy crust w a soft center. Ill def come back again when in the mood for a traditional sub on french. Def try the Tuna....like i said its made to order. So if u want loads of mayo you can have loads of mayo. Otherwise go light. Def a plus since places like Subway load up mayo etc.  P.s they also sell fresh Canollis. I wish i would have gotten one but hey they are right down the st from my office so ill def be back soon. P.s.s  Americas Best wasnt lying. Thumbs up for JP Grazianos.

The Mr. G. As good as described. An experience you need in your mouth. I had some friends coming in town who'd just vacationed in Italy. I was staking my town knowledge/food cred on this place being as good as advertised. (channels drunk Paula Abdul) TOUCHDOWN!!!! Yes, the grocery has been around since the '30s, when Chicago had a vibrant Italian(-American community) and when The West Loop was entirely animal carcases. Yes, it is a grocery with both domestic goods and imported deliciousness. My friends were delighted to see some of the foods they'd just eaten in Italy adorning the wall of JP G's. Yes, the people are as nice as advertised. They have a super solid product and have had it for some time. This could create an air of expectation, entitlement and lack of grace. You'll find none of these things. From the regulars who came in to shoot the isht, to n00bs like me and my friends to tourists, I never witnessed anything less than a genuine smile, honest conversation and sincere customer service. Many folks talk about treating customers like friends. Here, I witnessed it to be true. This is a family-run establishment and it feels like it. Yes to all these things. But, if you leave this review with no other knowledge know that the Mr. G is something you must experience as a Chicagoan, person who eats, person who enjoys happiness, etc. What's the big deal, right? It's a sandwich. Wrong. It's a transformative experience that translates love into a meal. In real Italian bread, where else can you taste (imported) provolone, two types of salami (one hot), prosciutto,TRUFFLE MUSTARD (holla if you HEAR me!!!), crunchy lettuce, balsamic vinegrette, hot oil, vinegar, (imported) artichokes, and fresh herbs. Combine that with chips and a San Pellegrino and you're set. Seriously. Almost every bite elicited a smile, giggle or shocked guffaw from my friends and I. A lot of sandwiches make the claim. Few stand up to the press. The Mr. G is truth. It's a new year. Resolve to get over to The West Loop and experience a true taste of Chicago. Also resolve to take it to go. There's a small seating area outside but now's not such a good time to use it.

The subs are made of high quality meats and fresh bread.  They have nice selection of Italian cooking staples.  My wife and I had the Italiano and Mr. G, respectively .  The guys behind the counter were friendly and attentive.  Plenty of traffic came in and out while we ate and everyone seemed happy.   The only (slight) issue we had was that the meat portions were not huge, but they were certainly well done.  We plan to be back.
Graziano's has the best subs in the city. They're all really good. It's a cool place to check out if you're in the area.

Had the Hot Italian and it was fantastic.   The meats were top notch and the D'Amato's bread was amazing.  I was also a big fan of the giardiniera.  Make sure you get it hot. I walked a mile from the loop each way at lunch time to get here and would do it again.  Looking forward to getting the Mr. G next...

Great Italian sub. The high quality meat, oil and bread are carefully balanced to create a sandwich that's really worth eating. The guys making the sandwiches are very nice. In a New York deli it's a cardinal sin to hold up the line by being the least bit indecisive, but the fellas here would patiently answer anybody's questions about the various offering while they worked. My only quibble is that it's a to-go place with only two tables to eat inside. So plan on taking your lunch else-where to eat it. If I were in the neighborhood, it's a be a definite go-to spot.
The Mr. G is the best sandwich I've ever had.  Husband agrees. Enough said.

Long time Bari's fan, but JPG has shaken that! Just like Bari, the meats are fresh and tasty, the bread is wonderfully crunchy. The differences are in the giardiniera and the dryness of the sandwich.  Bari's sandwiches are usually a bit on the dry side, where as JPG had the perfect combo of olive oil to bread, it went down easier and was better to chew.   The Giardiniera is the BOMB.  It is so tasty, it makes the sandwich!  It is also is the most obvious improvement over Bari. Note: there is a tiny surcharge for using a credit card

5 stars on the food and price. 2 stars on the service. I've been going to Graziano's for years.  Used to be that I could be in and out in 5-10 minutes tops any time of day, even the lunch hour.  Now I stand in line for 20+ minutes, and that's in addition to the time it takes me to get there.  Instead of a regular, I'm now an occasional.  I understand that its popularity has (deservedly) blown up, but it needs to respond appropriately with more staff, staff more appropriately used, or processes that move people in and out more quickly.  The owners/staff get five stars for being very friendly and creating a great product - it just needs some speed.

5 stars for food and service! I come here about once a week for lunch. If your in a hurry avoid going around 11 and 12 because there will be a line out the door. The service is fast and friendly. I have had both the prosciutto and tuna subs. Both are made on about a 1 foot italian loaf and stacked with the freshest ingredients. I like to order mine extra spicy by adding an assortment of peppers.  Come join the club! I'm working on eating 10 of of these delectable subs so i can get one free!

Awesome sandwiches! Pretty much the same as Bari. Although they do have one sandwich that Bari doesnt have and it's outstanding! The Mr. G is amazing. The truffle mustard and artichokes really give this sandwich mad flavor! If you like Bari you will like this place. If you have never been there before order your sub by the deli counter and pay in the back. My first time there it crazy busy and I had no idea how the process worked.

My two cents: 1. The sandwiches are good but not amazing. Tasty but didn't blow me away. 2. Super friendly employees. So 3 stars for the food, 5 stars for service. Do I plan to go back? Sure, if I'm in the neighborhood. Otherwise? Don't see any reason why I would.
Mr. G.. the sandwich.... so good.  Small grocery selection, nice outdoor seating.  Cant say much more....  literally every time I go I get the same thing so cant comment on much more than that.

The absolute best Italian sub sandwich - ever.  The "Mr. G" sub rocks.   Nothing else in the city can touch it in terms of quality and taste. It's so good it's not even funny...not even Italy can do better and that's because most of the ingredients are imported from the "old country."

I may stop going to Bari for my Italian subs & start coming here.  They get their bread from D'Amato's too.  The giardiniera and prosciutto may be a little better here.  So good.  My wife had an artichoke sandwich that she said may have been the best sandwich she'd ever had.  Sorry Bari.

Hands down the best sandwich in Chicago!  I live two blocks away and come here as much as I can.  I usually switch back and forth between the Italian and the Turkey. The meats, cheese, and the baguette is pretty much perfect. Sandwiches are cheap too, ranging from about $5.25 - $7.50.  I probably could eat here everyday if my wife would let me. Good for them that they got on 'Chicago's Best' tv show, but bad for me as this place gets really busy now.  Despite it being so busy, they have a system down pat.  Order at the sandwich station on the right and keeping on going to pay at the back window, then come back to pick up your sandwich.  The line was 20 deep, but the wait was only 15 minutes.

I have never had a sandwich so perfect in my entire life. Bread, cheese, meat, veggie, sauce ratios all perfect. Fantastic authentic ingredients.  oh yeah, and the owner/employees are all super nice, too!

The tuna sandwich is AMAZING, the tuna is made to order...artichoke hearts, mayo, hot giardiniera, roasted red peppers all mixed in...seriously amazing.  Mr G was good, but didn't knock my socks off.  I'll stick with the Italian & the tuna.

Yep, it's a five-banger for JPG's. I waited until I had a bit more experience here before writing anything so I could see if it was consistency or just coincidence that I fell in love with this place the moment I walked through the door. The "Mr. G." with hot peppers is the way to go, hands down. We ordered something like 20 sandwiches for an office lunch and I'm happy to report a complete success! All sandwiches made properly, all labeled properly, none forgotten nor screwed up. Everyone was quite happy, and very full.

This place was all I expected it to be.  The Mr. G was amazing.  There is nothing like fresh sliced deli, loved the truffle mustard and the fresh bread it was on.  I will be back here for sure.  Don't be fooled by the outside , it looks like a warehouse, best lunch place ever.

Stopped by this past Saturday afternoon after having watched/heard about this place through Chicago's Best.  We were immediately greeted when we walked through the door which made us feel very welcomed.  We were a bit confused when we walked in, as there was 2 lines and we weren't sure which one was to order and what the other was for. But after asking we figured out how the "system" works (you place your order then stand in other line to pay. then you go back to pick up your order)  I had the Tuna (create your own) sandwich and it was AMAZING! I'm not really one to order tuna but for some reason something told me to order it ,so i did. It was made just the way I asked for it and even better.  My partner had the Italian and it was also delicious! The bread on both sandwiches was perfect, crunchy and didn't get soggy.  I highly recommend this place and definitely will go back soon. The service was friendly and engaging. Wish there was more seating available.  *Some signs pointing new customers as to where to order and where to pay would be helpful.

Got recommended to this place by a TV food show, and after discovering that it was only a short walk from my office, decided to stop by for lunch. You can easily miss it since it's hidden among the many restaurants along the Randolph street corridor. It didn't matter how long the walk was or how long the line was for food...I was here to try out their subs.  Got to try their basic turkey sub: turkey, provolone, red peppers, mayo, lettuce and tomato on a toasted french bread. Overall, it was quite good. The peppers were a nice touch to the sandwich; normally you almost never find a place that adds it to a sub. I'm not normally a fan of french bread either (it's usually toasted too well and breaks apart as I bit into whatever sandwich it has), but the bread tasted pretty good too.  In my opinion, not the best sandwich in the world, but I'd come back.
This place is awesome.  I tried J.P. Graziano for the first time over the weekend, and I have a feeling I'll be back again very soon.  I highly recommend the Mr. G sub.
One of the best sub places in the city. Italian sub is great.

I have to say, they do make a damn fine sandwich. I found myself over here during lunch and had to stop in. It has a completely different feel on the inside than anything that I've seen. Just a real throwback, but in a modern way if that makes sense. The grocery part of it wasn't really all that big and it seemed more that their main aim is the sandwiches. Still, I bought two cans of tomato paste and they were 75 cents each. That's gonna bring absolutely zero complaints from me.  Onto the sandwich. I really wasn't sure what to get but I settled on the turkey. This was really good, plain and simple. It is a bit nitpicky, but I wish they had some more red peppers with it, but again, that's just being a bit of a nit. There was a good amount of meat on this.  There's a real family feel here and it makes you want to come back. Well, that and everything being very affordable. This is a nice gem in the west loop

Great place to pick up specialty Italian items and to grab a sandwich.  Their sandwiches are absolutely phenomenal and the ingredients are fresh and flavorful.  I highly recommend the prosciutto or the Italian sub sandwiches.
Best Italian sub in Chicago!

My co-workers and I decided to try this place out for lunch today....I'm planning to make this a regular lunch spot now. I love the fact that you feel like you are in Italy, and it has such a family owned and operated feel. It is still owned by the same family who started it, and all of them were very friendly. I ordered my sandwich, then went over to "Ma" and paid. All of the ingredients are fresh, and the meats and cheeses delicious. It's definitely a simple, no-frills atmosphere. The groceries seemed a bit pricey, so I may splurge on something, but not sure I could make it a regular to stock my shelves. In the midst of the changing neighborhood, this sub shop/grocer has stayed the same.

Another terrific Yelp find. The sandwiches are reasonably priced and quite delicious. I'm a big fan of the Turkey sandwich and always call ahead so it's ready when I arrive. It's nice to go to sub place where they know you. They have a Buy 10, Get 1 Free card that also keeps me coming back. If you find yourself in the Randolph Street corridor and don't feel like spending a ridiculous amount of money for lunch, this is a place that should be on your short list.

I stand by the Classic Italian with extra Provolone. However, I must recommend the sandwich I just devoured, The Turkey, add Salame extra Provolone. Holy smokes, absolutely brilliant! In my opinion, the best sandwich in the city. Raspo

This place will change your life. Finally I have found what I was looking for...a REAL Italian sandwich joint in the city of Chicago.   If you are a fan of beautifully cured Italian meats, fresh basil and delicious condiments such as truffle mustard balsamic vinaigrettes or if you have ever eaten/wanted to eat a sandwich, then JP's is exactly what you are looking for.   I highly recommend going with the Mr. G upon your first visit.  24 hours later, when you will surely want to return for another delicious creation, then it may be appropriate to branch out towards the spicy Italian, or tuna, or caprese...

Was looking for an italian grocer in the loop and based on the reviews on Yelp decided to venture past the Kennedy and check this place out.  It's located in the recently gentrified West Loop, surrounded by the trendy restaurants and lofts. Basically it's an Italian wholesaler that makes sandwiches on the side, As a result, everything is super fresh! I had the Mr. G, which as others have said, is a great sandwich. Can't say anything bad about sharp provelone, salami, capicola, artichokes, tomato and truffle mustard on a beautiful slice of italian bread. Exceptionally tasty - a great mix of sharp flavors.  The store has top notch cheeses, including homemade mozza and imported parmesano. However, their other italian staples are mediocre at best. In particular I was surprised that they had no fresh pasta at all! My other issue is that they are not cheap -  while sandwich prices are ok ($7-8), the groceries are really expenseive, especially for a wholesaler. Worth a visit once but stick with the sandwich!

We've been shopping here for the last few years. Simply put, Graziano's is like walking into the past, in a very good way. One of the few 'mom & pop' stores around. The new renovations (exposing the original doorway on Peoria) expand and modernize the space without loosing charm. Graziano carries high quality ingredients and has great service. The owner's enthusiasm for the store contagious. Today, they had blood orange juice available, which was tempting except for the fact we would be walking around in the heat for a long while before heading home.  Graziano also makes fresh sandwiches with D'Amatio's bread. They are not gourmet, but they are a great value and made with quality ingredients. A nice change of pace for the Randolph/Fulton area.

Memmmmmmoriesss... Just before I was born, my Italian grandparents and great-granparents moved their Italian resto from the city to the 'burbs after coming to the US from Italy before my mother was born.  At some point, they retired from the restaurant biz, and my g-parents settled into a house just blocks from my own. As a young kid, I remember my grandpa, still restless from the days where he was cooking huge Italian meals for hundreds of people, giving me an eye and asking if I wanted to go to "the city".  As a little kid it was so adventurous to sit in our giant 1980's Bonneville watching the fields and trees turn to skyscrapers and pavement.   Inevitably, each time we made the trip, we would venture to a seedy part of town just west of the loop, and my Grandpa would tell me to "act tough" as we walked down the sidewalk and into JP Grazianos.  Back then it was more of a warehouse-y food supply store for the restaurants in the city, but I swear I still remember that smell like it was 2 weeks ago.  My gramps and his "paisans" would speak Italian and I would dip my hands into the barrels of rices and grains, or one of the Italian ladies would sneak me a few olives or a slice of cheese.  It was heaven. As a teenager, I no longer wanted to make the treks to the city with my gramps, more important things to do, but my grandma would ask me to please drive as my grandpa's eyesight wasn't what it used to be.  Begrudginly I went and each time we made a stop at Grazianos.  I remember standing outside knowing that I would live in the city someday and hoping Grazianos would still be around... 17 years later, I have lived in the city for 10 years now, and my grandpa has passed, but all I need to do is drive down Randolph and smell the delicious smells coming from Grazianos and I know a little bit of him is still right here in the city with me, telling me to "act tough".

How could Mr. G. resist the Mr. G. sandwich??  One of my bosses recommended I try this place out, and it was DELICIOUS.  It was worth the slight trek to the west loop area, but it was worth it.  This section of Chicago is riddled with unbeliavably good eats, and J.P Graziano is no exception.

Overall great place. There are about ten seats outside (with two inside) so there's definitely room to relax and chill out.  When the bf asked Mr. G himself what he was famous before - he immediately pointed us to the Mr. G sandy.  Delicious.  Can't go wrong with this one- its got a great kick and a unique taste.

I work in the area, and head over about every two weeks for some of the finest italian sandwiches ever.  As good, if not better than Conte di Savoia on Taylor and Bari on Grand, and that's damn good. Have gotten great deals on terrific italian meats and cheeses for football party supplies in the past, and really need to go there more often and take advantage.  The regular presence of tough looking old italian grandmothers gives me faith this third generation spot is highly authentic.

Whether you call them subs, grinders, heros, hoagies, or sandwiches, this place knows how to make them!  I first found out about this place when I walked by it last week. I then read the reviews on Yelp and decided I have to see what everyone is raving about.  Excellent all around! I loved the turkey. I got there a little before noon and there was a line, but it moves quickly because these guys know their stuff!
There are totally lines now. I will assume because of my lovely review. Also, it's worth the wait.
Great Italian sub. Somehow, places where "my mother will ring you up at the window" always win me over.

Have tried the Mr. G and the Prosciutto sandwiches, which were both excellent.  Top quality, fresh ingredients.  Family-owned, very nice people.  Also, have had their catering a couple of times at a friend's parties, and would highly recommend them.
Love it!  Love the subs, the great cheeses and olives - I always leave with a HUGE bag of goodies.... And the family that runs the place are some of the nicest people I have ever met!

JP Graziano Grocery store is a blast from Italian past. Someone canned a little slice of the Old World with those tomatoes, olives, and balsamic then sent it directly to Chi-town, sprinkled in 4 generations of family run tradition and served it with a lil Italian flare and a smile. I stopped in on a cold windy wet lunch hour and was greeted with a warm smile by what seemed like the entire family. After a few, "How u doin's," the matriarch took over and gave me the entire run-down of what they offered and what they are known for, complete with a brief historical review and a mention of Yelp to boot.  It was very clear that they know subs, with several classic Italian offerings, + giardineira please (+25 cents only). Bonus, the subs are also huge and affordable = great deal. The sucker I am for a great Italian sandwich, i never got past the first offering on the menu (hot capicola, Volpi genoa salami, martadella, and provalone on warm crusty italian bread, yes please!).  As I scarfed my meal, I noticed the last item on the menu, the Mr. G, with provolone, hot sop, prosciutto, volpi salami, TRUFFLE mustard balsamic vinaigrette, hot oil, artichoke, fresh basil, and lettuce. That is a bonkers lineup and clearly a good reason to be called the house specialty.  Perhaps the best part, it's not just a deli. In fact, that part was added not too long ago. JP Graziano offers every item individually for sale in regular size of bulk wholesale. I will definitely be back for select italian meats (Volpi dry salami) and to tackle the Mr G.

Sandwiches with truffle mustard and roasted red peppers? Sign me up. I finally went here with a regular who's greeted by name when he comes in, which is apparently all the freaking time. After experiencing it for myself, I can see why. You walk in and the foodly smells hit you like a ton of bricks. Bulk spices kept in huge barrels perfume the air. There's also a great selection of imported Italian items like olive oil, cheeses, pasta, sauces and other assorted condiments, and you can't imagine how giddy I was when I spied truffle salt. Sandwiches are made to order with freshly sliced meats and cheeses and served on crusty Italian bread, and there's a couple of vegetarian options as well. They're seriously cheap and crazy good. There's only two tables inside the store, so you're better off eating outside (when they've got their tables set up) or taking a stroll over to a nearby park (as we did). Whatever you do, just go there, because you'll get a sandwich you can't refuse. The owners are some of the nicest people ever. I am usually not a fan of being called "Honey" (except by my sweetie) but it felt entirely appropriate and welcoming at Graziano.

Man oh man..if you dig deep enough you'll find gold. I am so reluctant to write this as I really do not want to spread the word. I have been eating subs all my life and this place is doing it right. Got a text from my brother at work after I finished my lean cuisine..."lunch today?? @Graziano's" I had not seen him in a while but I figure I go for his company, can ya' tell where this is going? Just go here. I got the Italian it was excellent.

A good Italian sub is hard to find. Thank god for Graziano's. This unassuming storefront puts out a very satisfying sandwich with uber fresh ingredients. The Mr.G is my favorite (the fresh basil is killer), but the Italian and the prosciutto sandwiches catch my eye too. Outdoor cafe coming soon? Look for me there.

Great sandwich and good if you want to grab some other food stuff.  I like the spicy and usually buy the side of the day.  the guys making sandwiches are nice and really cool and just really like this place.  Basically Bari's with a shorter line
delish!!!  we had ordered the mr. g which was great!!! also some olives, spices, soup, and salami ~all at great prices! the owners/workers were very friendly and helpful!

Stopped in here on a spring Saturday afternoon after never having seen it for about 5 years.  The place has character.  You walk in and there are these huge barrels with spices in them.  She sells the spice like 10oz. for $2. Wow!  And they have quick turnover because they sell to restaurants.  So it's fresh.  Then they have the deli counter where they fresh shave your deli meat for your sandwiches, and it is so fresh and potent and tasty!  The bread is a little crunchy, but not hard.  There are about 6 different types of sandwiches on their menu. A little further back in the shop they have cheeses in fridges, and salamis and meats and sauces.  Then on shelves they have pastas, canned goods, and sauces from their favorite Italian suppliers. The day we were in, the lady was at the counter, her brother was helping a couple choose meats and cheese and pasta for a dinner they were having, and both of them were so enthusiastic about the products, and very knowledgeable about each item's origin.  Their Mom was in the very pack at the payment counter.  Just such a friendly vibe, and a very obvious family run, proud business.  They re-did the front windows in the last year to make the place more welcoming. It worked! Stop in here for a sandwich, or spices or meats and cheeses.  This is a good business that deserves great patrons.  And you will be addicted to the very classic sandwiches!

This is a no frills italian grocery store with a sandwich area inside.  I read about their sandwiches and finally got to try the Mr. G.   Lots of fresh italian deli meat carefully stacked and expertly sauced.   I would definitely come back for the sandwiches again!
